title: Web Engineer, Remote
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We’re looking for a Web Engineer to help design and build a shared TypeScript SDK that centralizes reusable platform libraries, tools, and best practices. This SDK will make it easier for teams across our client to integrate with internal web infrastructure, improve consistency, and accelerate development workflows.
   

  

 This role is embedded within a broader platform mission rather than a single product team. You'll work in close collaboration with internal advisors, participate in a lightweight standup cadence, and lead a focused, well-scoped project. While not part of a formal team, you’ll be supported by stakeholders across the company.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design and develop a shared TypeScript SDK for use across our clients internal web stack.
* Consolidate platform libraries, gRPC wrappers, and common utilities.
* Engage directly with web infra teams to align on best practices and encourage adoption.
* Contribute to developer experience improvements through documentation and tooling.
* Join web-focused ceremonies (advisory boards, check-ins) and collaborate across platform missions.


**Requirements:**
* Strong expertise in TypeScript, including structuring libraries and reusable modules.
* Solid understanding of web infrastructure, including dependency management, build tooling, and API integration (e.g., gRPC).
* Ability to operate autonomously, navigate ambiguity, and drive alignment across teams.
* Comfortable interfacing with a variety of teams and disciplines to gather input and evangelize usage.
* Bonus: Experience contributing to SDKs, internal platforms, or developer experience teams.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Software Engineer
description:
Ready to combine deep engineering expertise and a product-first mindset to redefine the future of digital banking? As a Software Engineer at Nordiska, you’ll help shape system architecture, deliver complex features, and write high-quality coding - building embedded finance where banking meets tech.
   

  

**About Nordiska**
 Nordiska is a bank that provides innovative financial products for both companies and consumers. Nordiska Embedded is a platform for embedded financial services, where we offer savings, lending, and payment services, either under our own brand or through partners. Nordiska also provides corporate and real estate financing, as well as sustainable savings with a government-backed deposit guarantee.
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

 Our code of conduct is the foundation for everything we do. We act with honesty and responsibility to build long-term trust among customers, partners, and employees. We believe that diversity drives innovation and encourages each employee to contribute their unique expertise and perspective. We are driven and dedicated to making a difference. Our employees receive a competitive benefits package.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer, you will primarily work with Nordiska Embedded. We combine the best of two worlds - at our core, we’re a stable, regulated bank paired with a product-tech mentality that thrives on agility, curiosity, and innovation. As Nordiska expands into new markets, onboards new customers, builds new products and features - you work closely with the Tech Lead and Lead Engineer to set technical standards and ensure that the team’s output is robust, scalable, and secure. You’ll be an important part of modernizing systems, reducing technical debt, and are a key contributor to system architecture, complex feature development, and code quality.
   

  

 In addition to your technical work, you'll be mentoring mid-level and junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and being a part of a high-performing team, as we grow.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Drive engineering excellence by defining technical standards, system architecture, design principles, and long-term technology strategy for engineering excellence.
* Deliver high-impact features - implementing complex functionality that meets stringent performance, reliability, and security requirements.
* Drive initiatives that improve performance, enhance scalability, and reduce technical debt.
* Anticipate and resolve architectural bottlenecks, proactively preventing issues.
* Ensure best practices, clean code, testing/observability, and a culture of continuous learning.
* Ensure technical excellence through structured code reviews, consistent application of coding standards, and alignment with established best practices.
* Collaborate cross-functionally and work closely with Product and Engineering leadership to ensure technical execution supports strategic objectives.


 We’re Looking for Someone who has
   

  

* Mid- or senior-level depth in programming, frameworks, and system design in C#/.NET.
* Expertise in event-driven architecture (EDA) and Azure, with a strong interest in AI technologies considered an advantage.
* Hands-on expertise with architectural patterns, scaling strategies, performance optimization, security, scalability and resilience.
* Demonstrated capability to mentor others and lead by example.
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality, large-scale software systems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 Your Professional Profile
   

  

* As a true self-leader, you take ownership and operate effectively in a fast-paced, high-accountability environment.
* You communicate clearly, collaborate seamlessly across functions, and navigate confidently in a regulated context.
* You’ll contribute to a high-performing and humble team, bringing strong analytical skills and a proactive, solution-driven approach.


 Application & Process
   

  

 If you’re looking to join a growth-driven environment that pairs innovation with profitability and reliability, welcome to Nordiska. We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 We review and interview continuously, with background checks as part of the final stage of our process. For questions about the role, or for more information, you are warmly welcome to contact Ida Garamvölgyi at ida.garamvolgyi@nordiska.com or +46704-385 325.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experience with code refactoring and systems development
* Degree in Engineering or equivalent technical field (4 years)
* Deep knowledge in C#
* Not afraid of facing (and embracing) the unknown and working with exploratory tasks.
* Understand and agree with Test Driven Development and Behavior Driven Development
* Have a software engineering mindset, and a grasp of software engineering principles such as SOLID
* Team player with strong self-leadership, can-do attitude and business sense
* Experience with Unity (C#).


**Meritorious**
* Experience with games that have in-app purchases and/or games that have millions of players


**Application deadline:** 
 14-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: E-commerce Developer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As E-commerce Developer at our Stockholm you will take on a key role in the design and development of solutions for Acne Studios global E-commerce platform. You will work with Delivery Managers, QA Engineers and Solution Architects to deliver the best in e-commerce.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As an E-commerce Developer at Acne Studios, you will play a key role in shaping the digital shopping experience for our global clients. Your mission is to build and maintain scalable, high-performing web solutions that reflect our brand and support our international growth. You will report to the Head of Digital Development & Design and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver stable, customer-centric e-commerce experiences. You will:
   

  

* Develop and maintain scalable, secure and high-performance e-commerce solutions tailored to business needs and clients expectations.
* Translate business requirements into clear technical specifications and design documents in close collaboration with stakeholders.
* Integrate third-party technologies and services to enhance functionality, performance and user experience.
* Contribute to a fast-moving agile team, delivering high-quality solutions on time and within scope.
* Continuously improve site reliability, performance and scalability to support global expansion and ensure a seamless shopping journey.


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Strong problem-solving skills and a structured approach to development.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities across technical and non-technical team.


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Expert knowledge in JavaScript (ES5/ES6+), HTML, CSS
* Interest in modern tooling such as browser APIs and frameworks
* Familiarity with design patterns, APIs, and cross-language development
* Experience with the full e-commerce development cycle
* Exposure to Salesforce Commerce Cloud (nice to have)
* Fluent in English


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.
   

  

 We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today!

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Front-end Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6-24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is frontend using JavaScript and TypeScript, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust frontend applications, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a teams of different sizes.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Frontend Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of experience using JavaScript and TypeScript
* Solid skills in modern libraries and frameworks such as Next.js, React, Vue.js, Svelte, Node, NestJS, Angular, Express.js, Solid, React Native.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 Your mission when joining as a Software Engineer is to develop high-fidelity simulation platforms that test and validate the safety and efficiency of our Autonomous Vehicle Systems (ADS).
   

  

**You Will**
* Develop Scalable Infrastructure: Design, build, and maintain simulation platform infrastructure and test automation tooling to enable large-scale validation of autonomous vehicle software across diverse environmental and traffic conditions.
* Define Simulation Requirements: Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., ADS software developers, hardware engineers) and external partners to identify and define simulation needs and technical requirements.
* Drive Technological Innovation: Stay ahead of industry trends and advancements in simulation and automation technologies, continuously integrating best practices to enhance efficiency, realism, and scalability.


**We Expect You To Have**
* 3–5+ years of professional experience in software engineering, with a background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mechatronics, or Electronics.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* A passion for autonomous vehicle technology, solving complex problems, and developing innovative solutions.
* Enjoy learning from others and sharing your own knowledge to help the team grow.
* Are self-driven, proactive, and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.


**Bonus Skills**
* Proficiency in Go programming.
* Experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* AI/ML experience in software development.
* Open-minded and collaborative team player with the willingness to help others.
* Engineering solutions with an eye towards quality, performance.


 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Software Engineer - Mobile - JavaScript
description:
Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
 



  





 EAX In-game Experiences team is responsible for EA Connect, our social overlay facilitating cross-platform party, voip, quick messaging and game invites, used in most EA Sports titles. We are also responsible for the new Spotify integration recently released in FC 25.
 



 We are looking for someone to help us build experiences like this, both on mobile devices and consoles/PCs, using JavaScript and React..
 



  





 You will be based in the Stockholm office in a hybrid work environment. You will report to an engineering lead in the team.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* You will primarily be working with feature development in JavaScript, using TypeScript and React Native.
* You will also be working in React using an embedded JavaScript engine that connects to a C++ SDK in the game engine.
* You will help develop products used in multiple EA games
* You will partner with game teams and ensure the code works on several platforms, always with an eye on performance.
* You will be part of the broader engineering group, and an important contributor to the EAX team based in Sweden.
* You will design systems and APIs and contribute to technical design and reviews



  





**Qualifications** 
 :
 


* 7+ years of JavaScript programming experience
* Experience with frontend development
* Experience using TypeScript
* Experience using React Native

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Our client is expanding and looking for a skilled
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join their team. You’ll play a key role in developing a new implementation service that connects external data systems to their core platform, an important part of enhancing product performance and customer experience.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full stack using
 **React, TypeScript, Python and AWS** 
 , creating
 **serverless REST APIs, intuitive UIs, and robust ETL pipelines** 
 that enable smooth and efficient data flows between systems. The role offers end-to-end ownership and close collaboration with a small, driven team where your input truly matters.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop new features for the implementation service across backend and frontend
* Design and maintain serverless REST APIs
* Build UI/UX flows in React and TypeScript
* Work with ETL tools such as AWS Glue and DataBrew
* Collaborate with internal teams to improve data integration and automation



  





**Requirements:** 



* 3–5 years of experience in fullstack web development
* Strong knowledge of
 **JavaScript, TypeScript, and Python**
* Experience with
 **ETL processes and data integration**
* Understanding of
 **REST APIs and cloud services** 
 (preferably AWS)
* Passion for
 **clean, structured, and scalable code**
* Analytical and solution-oriented mindset



  





**Bonus:** 
 Experience with React, Vite, PySpark, SaaS platforms, or ETL/data pipelines.
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to join a fast-growing tech company, work with modern tools, and make a real impact from day one.

title: Unity Developer - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a skilled Unity Developer to join a dynamic gaming team. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the re-architecture of an existing game and help scale it for years to come. You will work closely with the Game Architect and Tech Leads to deliver technical improvements that enable new product capabilities and support the game’s long-term strategic vision.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Incrementally build and deliver technical architecture improvements within the game.
* Collaborate closely with the Game Architect and Tech Leads to investigate, design, and implement technical solutions.
* Actively contribute to evolving team processes, planning, and ways of working.
* Support re-architecture initiatives and codebase enhancements to ensure long-term scalability of the game.


**Requirements:**
* Strong experience in Unity (C#) development.
* Solid understanding of software engineering principles, including SOLID design.
* Experience with code refactoring and developing scalable systems.
* Familiarity with Test Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior Driven Development (BDD).
* Proactive, collaborative team player with strong self-leadership and a can-do attitude.
* Comfortable working on exploratory tasks and tackling unknown challenges.
* Degree in Engineering or a related technical field (or equivalent experience, minimum 4 years).


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Praktikant utvecklare
description:
LIA/Praktik: AI-utvecklare & Systemutvecklare hos Genassista
   

  

 Vill du vara med och bygga nästa generations AI-drivna lösningar? Vi på Genassista söker studenter för LIA/praktik inom AI-utveckling och systemutveckling. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i ett startup-team där innovation, entreprenörskap och teknik möts.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

 AI-utvecklare – krav
   

 • Erfarenhet av LLM (t.ex. OpenAI, HuggingFace, LangChain)
   

 • Kunskap inom textanalys och RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)
   

 • Modellträning och utvärdering (PyTorch eller TensorFlow)
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

 Systemutvecklare – krav
   

 • C#, Node.js, .NET
   

 • Erfarenhet av API-integrationer (t.ex. Google Classroom, Microsoft Graph)
   

 • Kunskap om molnplattformar (Azure, Google Cloud eller AWS)
   

 • DevOps/CI/CD (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, Docker)
   

 • Förmåga att designa systemarkitektur (backend, frontend, AI-moduler, databas)
   

 • Kvalitetssäkring av kod (CI/CD, code reviews)
   

 • Intresse eller grundkunskaper inom AI/LLM-integration är meriterande
   

  

 Vill du göra din praktik hos oss och vara en del av ett växande AI-startup? Skicka en kort presentation om dig själv och din utbildning till info@genassista.com

title: Frontend Developer Revenue Engineering
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a frontend engineer to join our Revenue Engineering team.
   

  

 The team is responsible for subscription & account management, checkout, product packaging & expansion/upsell.
   

  

 As a frontend engineer, you be involved in the whole feature development lifecycle from ideation to implementation, in close collaboration with other engineers, product owners, UX/UI designers and analysts. You will help ensure that our customers, whether small business owners or enterprise clients, have a smooth journey from onboarding to expansion.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain our web and mobile clients, collaborating closely with designers
* Work on multiple frontend codebases, optimize system performance, reliability, and cost efficiency
* Build and refine APIs to support subscription and account management
* Making sure our systems stay performant, reliable and cost efficient
* Run A/B tests end-to-end with the analytics team to iterate on functionality
* Contribute to a supportive, knowledge-sharing team culture


**About You**
 You're someone who thrives in a collaborative environment, enjoying the process of solving problems as part of a team. With a curious and open mindset, you're always eager to learn, explore new ideas, and embrace challenges.
   

  

 You know how to prioritise and adapt in a fast-moving setting while keeping sight of the bigger picture. Open communication is important to you, and you feel comfortable both giving and receiving constructive feedback in a supportive and respectful way.
   

  

 With at least three years of experience as a frontend engineer, you have worked with web frameworks, large codebases, and A/B testing, bringing both technical expertise and a growth-oriented approach to your work.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You feel at home building robust, maintainable web apps
* Strong proficiency in TypeScript and JavaScript
* You’ve worked with React and React Native before
* Comfortable with Git, Node, (p)npm and RN/browser dev tools
* Services are accessed using GraphQL and REST.
* Automated testing (especially front-end), for example with Jest/Vitest and Playwright.


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Marcus Revfalk at marcus@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Senior Backend Software Developer (Full-time)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
 Our Head of GO Cards Cédric and his team are looking for a Senior Backend Software Developer to join our Stockholm office. This role is ideal for someone experienced who wants to deliver real impact today while preparing to take on more responsibility in the future.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Impactful work: Your code directly powers secure identity services used by real customers worldwide.
* A pragmatic environment: We value smart choices over shiny tools. You'll use the most adapted technologies to solve problems, reduce complexity, and limit future technical debt.
* A healthy team culture: We believe in humility, collaboration, and keeping team well-being in balance with delivery goals.
* End-to-end responsibility: You'll see the whole lifecycle, from development through deployment to customer use.
* Growth into leadership: Over time, you'll have the opportunity to take on a bigger role in driving initiatives and supporting others in the team.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 You will join Nexus GO Cards team, our online service that lets customers order secure and customized identity cards (smart cards), key fobs, and accessories. Customers can order via our card management portal or integrate directly through our APIs.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Focus on backend development, with responsibility for services, databases, and system integrations.
* Develop, improve, and maintain services with a strong focus on reliability, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
* Select and use technologies based on problem-solving value, not trendiness.
* Ensure that deliveries are on time and secure, always balancing speed with quality.
* Collaborate closely with teammates and stakeholders, enabling fast and sustainable delivery.
* Over time, take a leading role in driving improvements in both technology and ways of working.


**Some Of Our Tech Stack**
* Java (primary language: deep expertise required)
* Spring Boot
* REST, Microservices, Databases
* Azure (cloud environment), Docker, Kubernetes


**About You**
* Highly experienced in backend Java development and proficient with Azure.
* Results-oriented: you deliver what is needed, when it is needed.
* Pragmatic: you enjoy new technology but choose what best solves the current problem while limiting technical debt.
* Humble and grounded: you listen, collaborate, and keep the team's health in mind.
* Independent yet collaborative: you take initiative but thrive in teamwork.
* User-focused: the end user's experience is always your guiding star.


**Qualifications**
* Extensive experience in Java backend development is required.
* 2+ years of experience with Azure DevOps is a must.
* Professional proficiency in English.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with Spring Boot and modern development practices is a plus.
* Solid understanding of Microservices and integrations is an advantage.
* Experience with cloud environments (Azure, Docker, Kubernetes).
* Cybersecurity knowledge.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Background check**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: Embedded System Software Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren systemutvecklare eller embedded engineer med intresse för teknik som gör skillnad på riktigt? Nu har du möjlighet att bli en del av ett säkerhetsklassat uppdrag inom försvarsindustrin där robust teknik, tillförlitlighet och nationell säkerhet står i centrum.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




 I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och underhåll av mjukvara eller inbyggda system i en avancerad och distribuerad miljö. Beroende på din bakgrund kommer du att bidra inom systemutveckling eller embedded-utveckling – alltid i tätt samarbete med andra tekniska discipliner. Du arbetar med hela kedjan: kravanalys, design, implementation, test och verifiering.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Minst 8 års erfarenhet inom systemutveckling (.NET, C#, Java etc.) eller embedded systems (C/C++, RTOS, HW-nära programmering)
* **Expertkunskaper:** 
 Java, ADA, C++, C, Python
* Goda kunskaper inom:
* Versionshantering (Git, CVS m.fl.)
* Linux-miljöer
* Jenkins och CI/CD-processer
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher såsom försvar, fordon eller medicinteknik
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och mycket god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Observera:** 
 Eftersom uppdraget är säkerhetsklassat krävs
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
 och att du kan godkännas i en säkerhetsprövning enligt svensk lagstiftning.
 



  





*Vill du växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss? Tveka inte – vi är bara en ansökan bort!* 




  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 




 Varje medarbetare är lika viktig i ALTENs framgång! Vi tror på att växa tillsammans genom att erbjuda möjligheter, utveckling och gemenskap.ALTEN verkar inom flera olika branscher, har en stor variation av uppdrag, coachande chefer och utbildning via ALTEN Academy vilket gör att det alltid kommer vara möjligt att utvecklashos oss. Dina önskemål styr din väg framåt.
 



 Som konsult får du både en teamkänsla i ditt uppdrag och en riktigt härlig gemenskap på ALTEN. Genom våra interna nätverk såsom Women@ALTEN och ALTEN Sports ges du möjlighet att driva frågor och aktiviteter som just du brinner för. På ALTEN tycker vi det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi tre extra lediga dagar per år.Hos oss är du ansluten till kollektivavtal ocherbjuds förmåner så som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkringar.
 



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda cirka 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom helaproduktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Försvar & Säkerhet, Energi, Industriell utrustning, Public service samt Life sciences. I Sverige är vi cirka 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 9kontor i 9 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
 



 ALTEN har för femte året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare avKarriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- ochutvecklingsmöjligheter.
 



 Välkommen in att läsa mer om oss på alten.se

title: Vision Software Engineer
description:
**DeLaval Is Looking For a Experienced Computer Vision Engineer**
 There are lots of opportunities for smart vision applications on a modern dairy farm. Today we supervise the condition of the cows and even control robots in real-time via vision. Tomorrow, we plan to do even more. Clever vision solutions will help farmers around the world to run their operations in a more efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced Computer Vision Engineer for our Data Science & Vision Team. This is a job where you clearly can see how your code will help the end customer every day. A trip to a farm now and then will also give you a better understanding of the environment and the problems we have to solve.
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Develop and maintain computer vision applications for the dairy industry
* Take part in Proof-of-Concept studies and innovation projects
* Evaluate new technologies and tools in the area of computer vision
* Continuously develop and refine our way of working with vision technology


**Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or similar
* Experience from working with product development in industrial companies
* C++ and OpenCV
* Computer Vision experience – preferrable both traditional- and model-based image processing
* Knowledge about cameras, optics and illumination for computer vision
* Embedded system experience is a plus
* Experience from robotic applications is a plus
* Embedded systems experience is a plus
* Ability to communicate in Swedish


**Personal Competences**
* Collaborative mind-set
* Ability to excel in an agile small team environment
* Curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking
* Not afraid of getting hands dirty on a dairy farm from time to time


**We offer you**
 An opportunity to work with vision applications in a creative and dedicated team with end-to-end responsibility.
   

  

 An exciting position at the forefront of technology in a market leading company with customers all over the world.
   

  

 A possibility to work with software development and vision technology in a different and fun area of application, where you solve real world problems and clearly can see the result of your work.
   

  

 The position will be located in Tumba, Stockholm, and reports to Björn Wiklander, Manager Data Science & Vision Technology. The job may occasionally require some travel to test farms, in Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Welcome with your application (in English)! We will review applications continuously. The last day to apply is December 20.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at www.delavalcorporate.com .

title: Documentum Developer
description:
**Company Description** 




  





 Skillhuset, based in Stockholm, specializes in connecting highly skilled IT consultants with leading companies across Sweden and Europe. We focus on delivering top-quality expertise in niche technologies at competitive prices, benefiting both our clients and consultants. Skillhuset believes in building long-term partnerships by understanding business needs and matching them with the right talent. We also have a branch in India, enabling us to provide highly skilled remote consultants, helping clients access top talent at a reduced cost while maintaining high-quality delivery. Whether you are a company seeking reliable experts or a consultant looking for exciting opportunities, Skillhuset is your gateway to growth and innovation.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 ﻿
 



 Documentum is an Enterprise Content Management system provided by OpenText. The D2 user interface of the Documentum system is currently what the client uses.
 



 ﻿
 



 Our customer has identified a need to utilize the API integration capabilities provided by Documentum. To achieve this, consultancy support is required to guide how to use the services offered by the Documentum API. The purpose of the consultant is to introduce the Documentum API to internal developers and provide guidance on implementing applications that consume the API.
 



 ﻿
 



 Must-have knowledge and experience:
 


* Deep knowledge of Documentum Content Management System architecture and integration capabilities.
* Kotlin
* Java



 ﻿
 



 Nice-to-have knowledge and experience:
 


* Understanding of the Life Insurance business.



 ﻿
 



**Planned Activities for the project:** 




 ﻿
 



 Documentum Environment Assessment
 


* Understand current Documentum architecture and components (Content Server, REST, D2, xPlore, etc.)
* Review documentation – Architecture and Design



 ﻿
 



 Life & Pension D2 Application
 


* Object model and metadata analysis
* Analyze ACLs, roles, and permission sets
* Review D2 configurations



 ﻿
 



 Authentication & Authorization
 


* Understand current authentication mechanisms (LDAP, SSO, etc.)
* Review authorization flows and integration with identity providers



 ﻿
 



 D2 Integration
 


* Conduct integration requirement analysis
* Define integration scenarios (e.g., document fetch)
* Perform gap analysis (e.g., metadata missing on the Documentum side)
* Identify performance, security, and compliance requirements
* Evaluate available APIs for integration (DFC, REST, DFS)



 ﻿
 



 Support Integration Design with CAMU Development Team
 


* Define architecture and data flow
* Design authentication and authorization model for integration
* Define error handling and logging mechanisms



 ﻿
 



 Implementation Support
 


* Provide walkthroughs of Documentum APIs and tools



 ﻿
 



 Development Support
 


* Assist with API usage and configuration
* Help troubleshoot issues during development



 ﻿
 



 Testing & Validation
 


* Support integration testing
* Analyze and resolve integration issues related to Documentum

title: Software Engineer at Swedbank specialised within Linux, Java, Oracle
description:
Are you an experienced Software Engineer looking to make an impact by working on strategically important projects alongside talented professionals? Group Treasury Department at Swedbank is looking for a new colleague to join our team on a temporary assignment (parental leave cover).
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Develop and maintain the Liquidity Management System (LMS), a core solution for Treasury operations
* Play a key role in delivering IT solutions aligned with Swedbank’s strategic goals and evolving regulatory requirements, impacting Payments and Liquidity Management
* Work in an agile, cross-functional team with a strong culture of collaboration
* Gain in-depth knowledge of Treasury processes through close collaboration with highly skilled colleagues


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A bachelor's or master's degree or equivalent in Engineering and/or Computer Science
* Solid, hands-on experience in Linux systems, Java development, and Oracle databases
* An understanding of IBM Integration Bus (Message Broker – Java)
* Experience of working with Network
* Experience in working with SAFe framework and agile ways of working
* Can do attitude and flexibility


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 become part of an international team of professional colleagues, who work together to deliver challenging projects, maximize customer satisfaction and contribute to Swedbank's position in society."
 **Charlotte Hanes, your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 21.11.2025.
   

  

**This is a temporary position starting from** 
**2025-11-01 until approximately 2026-09-01**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Charlotte Hanes, +46 706 296991
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have done our medium for recruitment and therefore decline contact with advertising sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Integration Developer
description:
**INTEGRATION DEVELOPER**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 As an
 **Integration Developer** 
 at Permobil, you will serve as the vital link between our business systems and the AI platform. You will design and maintain secure, scalable connectors that integrate our large language model (LLM) services with key tools such as Dynamics 365, SharePoint Online, Teams, Fabric, and Power Platform, enabling truly actionable AI across the organization. If you thrive on solving complex data and API challenges within Microsoft’s cloud ecosystem, this role places you at the heart of innovation and digital transformation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and build robust integrations between Azure AI services and enterprise systems (CRM, HR, ERP, IoT),
* Create reusable APIs, plugins, and Power Automate connectors to let agents execute business workflows,
* Develop logic apps, webhooks, and middleware using Azure Functions, API Management, and Service Bus,
* Implement secure data access using Managed Identities, Entra ID, and role-based access control,
* Monitor integration performance with Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Log Analytics,
* Work closely with Python and UX teams to expose function-calling endpoints for AI functions.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* Master/Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar education,
* 4+ years of experience with Azure integration services (API Management, Logic Apps, Functions, Service Bus),
* Proficiency in C#, Python, or Node.js for backend/middleware development,
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Graph API, Dynamics 365 APIs, or SharePoint REST APIs,
* Familiarity with Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps) for workflow automation,
* Solid understanding of REST / GraphQL API standards, authentication, and data security,
* Experience in enterprise system integration and change management,
* Experience in agile methodologies,
* Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is a plus.


**Meriting Skills**
* Experience with LangChain Tool Calling or OpenAI function calling patterns,
* Knowledge of event-driven architectures and Event Grid,
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps Pipelines and GitOps workflows.


**Who are you?**
 You inspire and motivate those around you, building strong collaboration and clear communication with stakeholders at every level. You actively encourage experimentation, viewing each new attempt as an opportunity for growth. You understand that failure is a stepping stone to success, helping to create an environment where curiosity, learning, and innovation are always encouraged.
   

  

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **December 5th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Christoffer Stigson, Director Digital Transformation, christoffer.stigson@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: iOS Developer
description:
*Vill du utveckla framtidens streamingupplevelse?* 




 Hos TV4 möts teknik, innovation, nyhetsjournalistik, sport och underhållning. Just nu är vi på en spännande resa för att bygga nästa generations streamingupplevelse – med målet att leverera Sveriges bästa mediaplattform för miljontals användare, varje dag. Nu söker vi en iOS-utvecklare till Player-teamet hos TV4!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Player-teamet bygger spelarna som utgör navet i TV4 Play – det som gör det möjligt för miljontals tittare att se innehåll, oavsett om de gör det via mobil, webbläsare, Smart TV, Chromecast eller andra plattformar.
 



  





 Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka hur hela Sverige upplever TV4 Play, varje dag.
 



 Vi jobbar med moderna tekniker och värdesätter ständig förbättring av våra system, vår kodbas och oss själva. Vi tror på agila metoder, testdriven utveckling, bra samarbete och ett stort fokus på kvalitet och prestanda.
 



  





**Vidare kommer du att:** 



* Utveckla och optimera vår videospelare, i denna roll med fokus på iOS och tvOS.
* Säkerställa en förstklassig användarupplevelse med fokus på prestanda, kvalitet och stabilitet.
* Integrera teknologier för streaming, DRM och reklamhantering i våra spelare.
* Samarbeta tätt med andra utvecklingsteam för att driva streamingupplevelsen framåt.
* Arbeta i ett fokuserat spelarteam på cirka 5–7 personer.



  





**Om dig** 




 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du drivs av att bygga stabila och högpresterande lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad för användarna. Du trivs i en miljö där teknik, kvalitet och upplevelse hänger tätt samman och där samarbete är en naturlig del av vardagen – både inom teamet och över teamgränser. Dessutom har du förmågan att förklara komplexa tekniska samband på ett pedagogiskt och tydligt sätt, oavsett om mottagaren är teknisk eller inte.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att utveckla videospelare eller arbetat nära videouppspelning på Apple-plattformar, exempelvis med:** 




  




* Swift
* AVFoundation
* HLS
* FairPlay DRM



  





**Meriterande erfarenhet:** 



* React Native, Expo, Metro
* Videouppspelningstekniker (HLS, MPEG-DASH) och verktyg som FFmpeg
* Streamingflöden: ingest, transcoding, packaging, CDN, player
* QoE-aspekter: buffering, bitrate switching, startup time
* DRM-hantering och skyddat innehåll
* Integrering mot analysplattformar (t.ex. MMS, NPAW/Conviva)
* Reklam och monetarisering: VAST, VMAP, SSAI, CSAI
* Web & Chromecast: TypeScript, React, Shaka Player, hls.js, Widevine DRM



  





**Mer om erbjudandet** 




 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm (TV4-huset) med gångavstånd till Gärdets tunnelbana. Kontoret erbjuder eget gym, parkeringsgarage, restaurang samt takterrass.
 



  





**Rollen erbjuder även:** 



* Kollektivavtal, tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag
* Vara en del av TV4:s ekosystem och ta del av våra tjänster
* Rabatter via Benify
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och möjlighet att växa inom organisationen
* Arbete i en sann AI-first-kultur där du får påverka vår AI-resa framåt
* Engagerade kollegor och ett team som tillsammans driver TV4 mot att bli Sveriges bästa mediaplattform



  





*TV4 samarbetar tillsammans med Safemind i denna rekrytering.* 




  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

title: iOS Developer
description:
BookBeat söker just nu en ny utvecklare till vårat iOS-team. Teamet består av 4 utvecklare, som dagligen jobbar nära våra androidutvecklare och backendutvecklare där vi tillsammans älskar att hitta lösningar på problem. Problemen vi löser är ofta av teknisk natur, men vi är alltid med och bidrar tidigt i processen när nya eller existerande features ska utvecklas.
 



  





**Några ord från din framtida manager:** 




 Hej, jag heter Jonas och är manager för iOS och Android-utvecklarna på BookBeat. Majoriteten av min tid på jobbet spenderar jag med att skriva Swift-kod för vår iOS-app. Jag är en av de fyra utvecklarna som du kommer att jobba dagligen med. Jag älskar att svara på frågor, att få ställa frågor och att lösa problem tillsammans. Jag är stationerad på vårat satellitkontor i Karlstad, men du och övriga delen av teamet sitter i Stockholm. Självklart dyker jag upp på kontoret i Stockholm på regelbunden basis, och vi kommer dagligen att ha kontakt digitalt.
 



  





 Du kommer spendera större delen av din tid i våran kodbas som består av 100% Swift-kod och majoriteten av UI't är skrivet i SwiftUI. Vi driver våran kodbas mot Swift 6.2 och älskar async/await. All kod som produceras för appen går igenom pull requests i GitHub, och tiden från skapad pull request till mergad kod är oftast kort. Vi gillar bra struktur på pull requests och att göra det lätt för den som ska titta på koden att reviewa.
 



  





 Jag tror att du är engagerad i det du gör och i ditt yrke; du bryr dig på riktigt om det som du och ditt team bygger och vilken effekt det ger. Tillsammans är vårt gemensamma mål på BookBeat att bygga Europas bästa tjänst för att hitta och uppleva digitala böcker.
 



  





 Du kommer, tillsammans med resten av utvecklingsteamen på BookBeat, att ha en viktig roll i hur vi skapar den bästa möjliga upplevelsen för våra över 1 miljon kunder och oss själva. Vi som utvecklare jobbar väldigt nära våra produktägare och UX-experter och är med och direkt påverkar hur appen ska se ut och fungera.
 



  





 I korthet kan man beskriva BookBeats kultur som startup-lik med få inslag av "corporate". Rent konkret betyder det att vi som anställda har mycket frihet, det finns möjlighet att ta snabba beslut och man får vara med och påverka saker även om det såklart också finns en del satta processer och guidelines. Ekonomiskt står vi på egna ben och är lönsamma med Bonnier som ägare.
 



  





 Jag vill att du är väldigt nyfiken, inte bara på teknik och kod, utan även på hur och varför saker görs. Det kan handla om allt från teknik och domän till människor, team och organisation. Du förstår att det är helheten som spelar roll i slutändan.
 



  





 Du inser vikten av att vara öppen för nya idéer och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper med andra utvecklare och specialister för att både BookBeat och du själv ska kunna utvecklas.
 



  





**Din bakgrund:** 



* Du är nyutexaminerad och vill få en raketstart på din karriär i ett team med hög lägsta nivå som mer än gärna tar dig under sina vingar.



*eller* 



* Du är en iOS-utvecklare som känner att nästa utmaning finns hos ett produktbolag med kompetenta kollegor, moderna tekniker och stor frihet.



  





**Du är:** 



* Alltid mån om att hela tiden vilja bli bättre på det du gör
* Du brinner för att skapa riktigt bra lösningar
* Inte rädd för att ställa frågor, hur dumma de än känns
* Du gillar att utmana, förändra och förbättra, samtidigt som du har förståelse för slutanvändaren och intresse för helheten. Du tar ägarskap, är hands-on och får saker att hända
* Inte rädd för att göra fel, och ser misstag som ett tillfälle att lära sig



  





**Vi tror att du:** 



* Har ett brinnande intresse för iOS
* Gillar Xcode och älskar Swift
* Alltid strävar efter att bidra med högsta möjliga kvalitet
* Vill bidra med idéer för nya funktioner samt tekniskt utförande
* Trivs i en organisation där alla jobbar nära varandra i en kreativ och prestigelös miljö
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska



  





 Om du är intresserad - skicka in din ansökan och berätta om din erfarenhet och varför du är rätt kandidat för oss! Vid frågor är du välkommen att höra av dig till mig, Jonas Ullström, på jonas.ullstrom@bookbeat.com
 



  





**Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:** 




 🌴 30 dagar semester per år
 



 💰 ITP1-tjänstepension
 



 💌 TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring
 



 🎾 Årligt friskvårdsbidrag
 



 🤸 ♂️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme
 



 💻 Arbetsutrustning (MacBook, iPhone och Apple Watch) samt abonnemang
 



 🎧 BookBeat-prenumeration
 



 🏥Företagshälsovård för att säkerställa ditt välmående
 



 👶Föräldraledighetsförmån för att stödja din växande familj
 



 📃Kollektivavtal
 



  





**Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:** 




 💜 En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi använder flextid och jobbar 37,9 timmar per vecka
 



 🏢 Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm
 



 🏃 ♀️ … inklusive tillgång till ett fullt utrustat gym med bastu! Vi arrangerar också ett gäng roliga aktiviteter med koppling till hälsa och välmående, såsom vår egna springklubb
 



 🚀 Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling
 



 ✨ Roliga aktiviteter tillsammans med dina kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget
 



 🧪 Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days
 



 🧠 Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!
 



 🤛 (Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 10 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 1 miljon användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.
 



  





 Idag består Team BookBeat av runt 170 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:
 



  





 🚀 Var fantastisk på det du gör
 



 📣 Dela det du vet och kan
 



 🔎 Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss
 



 🤝 Bygg Team BookBeat
 



  





 Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.
 



  





**Sist men inte minst:** 




 Om du känner att du skulle kunna vara den vi söker, men du kanske känner dig osäker på exakt vad det innebär att driva kodbasen mot Swift 6.2, eller att det verkar läskigt att jobba dagligen med sin chef, eller om du har en släng imposter syndrome, så vill vi säga: ansök ändå! Vi är ett högpresterande team, men vi är i grund och botten ett gäng personer som inte kan allt och som gör misstag. Vi gör vårt bästa och vill hela tiden bli bättre, och så länge du också gör det så kommer det bli toppen.

title: Senior Dynamics CE Developer
description:
*Are you the developer who thrives on solving complex challenges, fine-tuning every line of code, and pushing Dynamics 365 CE beyond its limits? Join Dustin’s Dynamics team to shape the future of Dynamics 365 in an international setup.*
*We are* 
 looking for someone who lives to code, thrives on technical challenges and loves diving deep into the guts of Dynamics 365, Azure integrations and custom business logic.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer unique**
* A senior role designed for developers who want full ownership of code and innovation.
* Take ownership of designing and delivering innovative technical solutions that drive business transformation.
* A collaborative environment where a "win as a team" attitude prevails, fostering growth and success collectively.


 You will be part of the Dynamics team, with current operations live in BNLX and an exciting project underway in the Nordics. We encourage a welcoming and collaborative environment, with a mix of personalities and an international team, ensuring everyone works together to achieve success.
   

  

*Read more about Dustin here*
**Your role & influence as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will play a crucial role in designing, developing and implementing solutions within the Dynamics 365 CE platform to meet the business requirements. This role includes managing releases, coordinating connected ISVs, ensuring code quality, maintaining Dynamics environments, troubleshooting issues, and driving technical excellence.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver seamless Dynamics 365 CE solutions and technical releases, ensuring high-quality outcomes.
   

  

 This role requires a strong understanding of Microsoft technologies, CRM development expertise, and the ability to analyse complex business requirements to propose efficient solutions.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Write high-quality, high-performance and maintainable code, and ensuring smooth solution releases.
* Conducting design reviews, troubleshooting, and maintaining environment stability.
* Collaborating to align technical solutions with business requirements in line with industry best practices.


**Benefits of** 
**joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

 You can find more of our Swedish benefits below in the vacancy.
   

  

**This** 
**is what we imagine you bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who combines senior-level expertise in Dynamics 365 CE, .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Power Platform, and Azure DevOps with excellent communication skills and a passion for collaboration and problem-solving.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Nice That You Have**
* Bachelor's degree level of working and thinking and 5 years’ or more experience of similar job.
* Experience with API integrations, Dual Write, and release pipelines.
* Strong technical skills in Azure services like Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Service Bus.
* Proficiency with SQL Server and related database management tasks.


**What** 
**can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with Hiring Manager, Mirjam Stegeman and a colleague.
* Technical (Second) interview with future colleagues from the team.
* A possible final Interview with Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström.
* Professional References.


******Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support.******
**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via karishma.sindhu@dustin.com.

title: Project Sourcing Manager
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Project Sourcing Manager** 
 to join DeLaval and play an important role in shaping the future of our products and solutions. In this position, you’ll represent the sourcing function within cross-functional project teams, making sure our sourcing strategies align seamlessly with project requirements. Your engineering know-how and strategic sourcing expertise will help us deliver on both project and business objectives.
   

  

 As part of the project team, you’ll be involved in creating innovative products that will serve our customers for years to come. This role calls for strategic thinking, creativity, and a sharp eye for detail.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 You’ll act as the sourcing representative in projects related to
 **New Product Introductions (NPIs)** 
 and
 **Product Change Assignments (PCAs)** 
 . This means evaluating and selecting suppliers, negotiating agreements, and ensuring everything aligns with global sourcing strategies and project needs. You’ll work closely with suppliers to integrate their insights and innovations, helping us enhance product performance and value.
   

  

 Your role also includes identifying external technologies that complement our internal capabilities, managing product phase-ins and phase-outs, and collaborating with colleagues across sourcing, engineering, product development, and management. Compliance with company policies, quality standards, and sustainability goals will be part of your daily focus. You’ll also prepare sourcing reports and share updates and recommendations with management.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have a university degree in engineering or equivalent, and ideally additional qualifications in supply chain, procurement, or project management. With at least five years of experience in project sourcing, strategic sourcing, or supply chain—preferably in a multinational industrial setting—you bring proven skills in project management and total cost sourcing.
   

  

 Your technical understanding allows you to translate engineering requirements into sourcing actions. You’re experienced in supplier evaluation, negotiation, and contract management, and familiar with ERP systems, ISO, TQM, and modern management tools. Fluency in English is essential and Swedish or other languages are a plus.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re a strong communicator who thrives in cross-functional and cross-cultural environments. You have a proactive mindset, a structured and analytical approach and you think strategically. Your commercial acumen and negotiation skills are top-notch, and you’re passionate about continuous improvement and achieving results. Integrity and reliability are at the core of how you work.
   

  

 On the technical side, you bring knowledge in mechanical engineering and a strong understanding of manufacturing processes. This includes hands-on knowledge of metal fabrication, machining and plastic processing technologies such as injection molding. Your background enables you to interpret complex technical requirements and actively contribute to product development, while working closely with engineering teams and suppliers to ensure optimal design and production outcomes.
   

  

**What Success Looks Like**
 You’ll meet project cost, quality, and timing targets, implement sourcing strategies that align with business needs, and contribute to ongoing improvement and cost reduction initiatives.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.


****Additional information****
 This is a full-time, permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. Travel will be part of the role, and we offer a hybrid workplace model for flexibility.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Group Product Manager - Backstage
description:
Originally conceived in Spotify, Backstage is now a leading SaaS and open source platform for building developer portals. Backed by many firms, Backstage assists in coordinating microservices and infrastructure, enabling teams to deliver outstanding code amidst AI advancements.
   

  

 About the position: We are looking for a creative, passionate, and experienced Product Leader to join our Backstage Product Area in Spotify.
   

  

 Our mission at Backstage is to unleash creativity and innovation for developers in the age of AI, while creating delightful experiences. Through the last couple of years, Backstage has enabled thousands of organizations, including fortune 100 companies, to shift and transform their engineering culture, creating centralized software catalog, standards and accelerate AI adoption and effectiveness with our different offerings: Open source, plugins and SaaS products.
   

  

 Guide product managers, coordinate our SaaS product, work in an agile startup environment, and aid product expansion.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Guide the improvement of our key product user experience with mixed teams.
* Manage a team of product managers, mentor, guide and scale the team impact.
* Develop a comprehensive strategy and vision for the product, aligning with the overall business goals.
* Lead the creation and execution of the product roadmap, ensuring that it aligns with the strategic vision and addresses customer needs.
* Prioritize features and make data-driven decisions based on market research, user feedback, and performance metrics.
* Communicate effectively with partners, including executives, cross-functional teams, and customers, to ensure alignment and consensus.
* Engage closely, and create processes for the team to collaborate successfully with cross-functional teams like sales, marketing, design, user-research and insights


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have significant experience in building and shipping customer-facing software products together with teams of designers, engineers and data scientists.
* You have 10+ years of experience in product management roles
