title: Product Owner Customer Portal B2B
description:
**Own the experience that defines how our customers interact with us.**
 You’ll own our digital customer portal — the platform where our B2B customers manage their services, track usage, handle invoices, and connect directly with our teams. It’s where the entire customer relationship comes together — and where your decisions will shape how thousands of customers experience us every day.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You’ll set the direction, roadmap, and priorities for the customer portal, making sure we focus on what truly matters — to customers and to the business.
   

  

 Your work will start with listening: to customer feedback, usage data, and improvement ideas that come from across the organization. You’ll translate those insights into clear, actionable priorities and balance them against business expectations, technical feasibility, and resource realities.
   

  

 You’ll be close to the development team, driving delivery in agile sprints while keeping a sharp eye on outcomes, not just output. You’ll also manage a wide set of stakeholders — aligning needs, pushing back when needed, and creating shared understanding of what success looks like.
   

  

 Major projects ahead include preparing and leading portal rollouts in Germany and Denmark, aligning business cases, and securing successful launches together with our local teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the product vision, goals, and roadmap for the customer portal.
* Gather, structure, and prioritize customer feedback and translate it into clear user stories.
* Balance customer input with stakeholder expectations and resource constraints, ensuring focus on what creates the most value.
* Collaborate closely with developers, analysts, QA, and architecture to deliver solutions that work in practice.
* Own and refine the backlog, making data-driven decisions on priorities.
* Follow up on performance, adoption, and satisfaction metrics, driving continuous improvement.
* Support new market launches, securing alignment and readiness across teams.


**What You Bring**
* At least 4 years of experience as a Product Owner or similar role within IT or digital product development.
* Proven ability to deliver results in both agile and waterfall environments.
* Strong stakeholder management skills — from operational teams to C-level.
* Hands-on experience with roadmapping, backlog ownership, and prioritization using Jira or Confluence.
* Confidence in facilitating discussions and presenting ideas clearly, supported by strong PowerPoint and storytelling skills.
* Fluent in English.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience working with UX or Figma.
* Background in B2B portals, SaaS, or digital service platforms.


**The team**
 You’ll join a tight and collaborative product team — five developers, a data analyst, another product owner, an acceptance test lead, and a rollout project manager. The team works agile, moves fast, and values clear priorities over noise. You’ll have real ownership — space to shape the roadmap, define priorities, and turn insights into impact.
   

  

**Why you will enjoy this role**
 This is a pretty cool portal – if you are creative and enjoy good visual UX and want to be in a position and environment where you get to test things, and where things are always happening. You will get to really focus on the customer experience – and your fantasy till be the only limit to what you can propose.
   

  

**The Process**
 Screening interview – With TA Partner
   

  

 First interview – With Hiring manager Milica
   

  

 Testing
   

  

 Case interview
   

  

 References
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Senior Analyst/Analytics Manager- Fraud Risk
description:
**What you will do** 




 In this role, you will design, test, and deploy real-time fraud decisioning strategies - combining rules and ML models across products and markets, while analyzing high-volume event data to uncover emerging patterns such as account takeover, synthetic identities, mule activity, refund abuse, and first- or third-party fraud. You’ll run champion/challenger experiments and A/B tests and continuously monitor precision/recall, false-positive rate, approval rate, loss bps, chargeback rate, and customer friction. You’ll build detection features and signal pipelines in close partnership with Engineering, Product, and Data Science; lead incident response during fraud spikes with clear mitigations and post-mortems; and evaluate and integrate vendor signals device, identity, behavioral, telco, sanctions/PEP, and 3DS where they deliver measurable lift. Above all, you’ll translate insight into action through clear, concise specifications and rollout plans, supported by alerting dashboards and stakeholder updates that drive fast, high-quality decisions.
 







**Who you are** 



* 3–8+ years in fraud strategy/analytics or credit underwriting/risk decisioning within payments, consumer finance, or large-scale e-commerce
* Hands-on with SQL and Python or R to prototype analyses and experiments
* Ownership of a production fraud/credit policy or modeling strategy with demonstrated KPI impact
* Strong experiment design skills (A/B testing, champion/challenger), metric trade-off evaluation, and post-deployment monitoring
* Excellent communication with senior stakeholders; able to influence and drive decisions quickly



**Awesome to have** 



* Experience with fraud/risk vendor ecosystem (e.g., device fingerprinting, identity graphs, behavioral biometrics, 3DS/SCA) and structured evaluation methods
* Knowledge of PSD2/SCA/3DS and TRA exemptions; able to design compliant controls without harming conversion
* Exposure to LLM-assisted investigations (case summarization, entity extraction, workflow automation)
* On-call support experience during active fraud attacks and ability to perform under pressure



 Please include a CV in English.
 







 Curious to learn more about Klarna and what it’s like to work here? Explore our career site!

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Join Our Diverse Team At Crane Currency As a Marketing Coordinator In TUMBA And Be a Part Of Our Journey Towards Innovation And Excellence. (Maternity Cover Position, 1-year Contract) Who We Are
   

  

 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.  Learn more at www.cranecurrency.com
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 We are looking for someone who is passionate about and has a degree in marketing, media or communications to help us fill a parental leave of absence for 1 year. We work as a team of self-starters, in a high-trust environment, where, as individuals we are pulled into complex tasks in front of the computer screen before working face-to-face with fellow associates and customers. If you enjoy working in an international workplace and have some years of experience of organizing events, then we may have the perfect job for you.
   

  

* Coordinate execution of customer events, alongside Marketing Manager and Director.
* Coordinate resources for Crane-sponsored industry conferences.
* Coordinate the marketing materials database and materials inventory.
* With direction from the Marketing Manager, coordinate day-to-day marketing activities to meet short- and long-term business objectives, and comply with safety and security requirements.


****Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****
**Required:**
* Education: Minimum of an Associate degree required; a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics,International Business, or Communications is strongly preferred.
* 1-2 years of experience in a Marketing or Sales function with customer focus.
* Language: High proficiency in English, capable to proofread text and create content.
* Communication: Able to express ideas clearly and confidently, both in writing and verbally.
* IT: Very strong working knowledge and/or experience in Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Umbraco or other web based platform. Photoshop, InDesign, Premiere Pro CC, SharePoint, Salesforce.
* Willingness to travel internationally 3-4 times per year, and on short notice.


**Preferred:**
* Analytically focused studies (e.g., programming or statistics) are a plus
* Proficiency in additional languages are a plus.


****Tumba-Benefits****
****How we will care for you:****
 We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

**What Drives Our Team**
 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
   

  

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


**Learn More About Our Values And Culture**
 You can also check us out at:
   

  

**Where We Are**
 Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, five-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Check out what makes Tumba a great place to live and work here:
   

  

 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
   

  

 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

**#ONSITE**
