title: Product Development Operations Lead
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 The Silicon Product Development Operations Lead plays a key role in driving operational excellence across the PEU Silicon and RAN Compute & Cloud Infrastructure (CCI). Working in close partnership with product development and functional leaders, the role ensures smooth execution of operational plans, resource alignment, vendor collaboration, and delivery governance that supports our silicon and compute programs.
   

  

 You will connect strategy to execution by coordinating cross-functional processes, tracking operational performance, and driving improvements that enhance speed, predictability, and compliance. A sound understanding of silicon development lifecycles, terminology, and product development frameworks will be key to effectively navigating this environment.”
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead operational planning and coordination activities that enable effective program execution across Ericsson silicon development areas.
* Partner with Procurement and Finance to align vendor engagements and external partner activities with program and budget objectives.
* Monitor and report on operational metrics related to delivery progress, capacity, and efficiency.
* Serve as an operational interface between Engineering, HR, Procurement, and Finance to maintain alignment and resolve execution challenges.
* Support program managers by ensuring operational prerequisites and governance processes are in place for successful project delivery.
* Contribute to initiatives that strengthen organisational scalability and operational discipline across development units.


**Skills You Bring**
* 10+ years of experience in product or business operations within a technology or R&D organisation.
* Familiarity with silicon product development processes, terminology, and operational workflows — or demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a technical engineering context.
* Strong understanding of operational frameworks, vendor governance, and cross-functional program coordination.
* Proven ability to drive structured execution, influence stakeholders, and manage operational dependencies in complex environments.
* Skilled in enterprise tools such as SAP Fieldglass, XRM.
* Excellent communication, organisational, and analytical skills with a proactive and structured mindset.
* Recognised for precision, discretion, and a focus on enabling teams to deliver efficiently and effectively.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city: Sweden: Stockholm**

title: Digitaliseringsledare
description:
Är du en lagspelare som drivs av att utveckla verksamheter och att hitta smartare arbetssätt med hjälp av ny teknologi? Vi ser att digitalisering är en möjliggörare och en direkt förutsättning för att vi ska nå våra mål som hållbara, kostnadseffektiva och trygga. Vi söker därför dig som vill jobba som Digitaliseringsledare och ta oss vidare på vår digitaliseringsresa.
   

  

**Om rollen som Digitaliseringsledare**
 Som Digitaliseringsledare bidrar du till att effektivisera vår verksamhet genom att utnyttja de möjligheter som digitaliseringen erbjuder. Du har förmågan att översätta framtidens teknik till lösningar som är i linje med vår verksamhet och digitala riktning.
   

  

 Innovation och att skapa verksamhetsnytta är grunden i ditt uppdrag. För att lyckas behöver du sätta dig in i vår affär och verksamhetens behov. Genom dialog med verksamheten identifierar du behov som du omvandlar till förslag på smartare digitala arbetssätt och tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Du får vara med och driva utvecklingen av vår digitala transformation. Du planerar, leder och koordinerar projekt inom digitalisering och automatisering, där uppföljning och utvärdering är naturliga delar. Du följer upp avtal och samarbetar nära med systemleverantörer och externa konsulter samt interna intressenter.
   

  

 Du har ett holistiskt synsätt, både vad gäller teknik och verksamhetsnytta, och är ambassadör för vår digitalisering. I samverkan med dina kollegor föreslår och driver du strategiska planer med både kort- och långsiktigt perspektiv för att möjliggöra en förflyttning.
   

  

 Du tillhör vår enhet för Digitalisering, som består av Digitaliseringsledare och IT-samordnare.
   

  

**Om din bakgrund**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Digitaliseringsledare är dina personliga egenskaper avgörande. Du är drivande, strukturerad och tar initiativ till att lösa uppgifter med ett positivt, fokuserat engagemang och integritet. Du är skicklig på att bygga relationer och trivs i rollen som brobyggare mellan teknik och verksamhet.
   

  

 Du har god förståelse för både verksamhet och teknik samt en stark vilja att förstå affären och hur du bäst kan stödja dess utveckling.
   

  

* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet som Verksamhetsutvecklare eller Förändringsledare.
* Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av innovation, kravhantering och agila metoder inom digital utveckling.
* Erfarenhet inom GIS-området är önskvärt.


 Du är van vid att utforma planer, beslutsunderlag och presentationer anpassade för olika målgrupper. Du har god förmåga att sammanfatta och formulera dig på svenska i både tal och skrift. Som person är du engagerad, nytänkande och ansvarstagande, med förmåga att arbeta strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt. Du har erfarenhet av att implementera nya digitala arbetssätt och att pedagogiskt göra tekniska lösningar till en naturlig del av verksamhetens vardag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med akademisk utbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

**Om SISAB**
 Vi skapar Stockholms bästa skolmiljöer för barn och unga och bidrar till stadens utveckling.
   

  

 SISAB, Skolfastigheter i Stockholm AB, är ett kommunalt bolag inom koncernen Stockholm Stadshus AB. Vårt mål är att erbjuda utbildningsmiljöer med hög kvalitet, sund ekonomi och långsiktig miljöhänsyn. Vi ansvarar för fastigheter där 200 000 barn, unga och vuxna vistas dagligen. Vi arbetar för att erbjuda alla Stockholms unga trygga, hållbara och kostnadseffektiva fastigheter.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Annonsen kan komma att avslutas tidigare eftersom vi granskar ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att registrera din ansökan via länken nedan. Varmt välkommen att bli en del av vårt team!
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Rekryterande chef Rolf Amble. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta HR Business Partner Marie Langheden. Båda nås via SISAB:s växel på telefon 08-508 460 00 eller via mail: förnamn.efternamn@sisab.se
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om SISAB:s rekryteringsprocess och få en inblick i hur det är att jobba hos oss.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med inledande 6 månaders provanställning.

title: People & Operations Director
description:
**People (HR) & Operations Director SSC Nordic & Baltics - Husqvarna** 




  





 We’re one of the world’s oldest start-ups — and we’re just getting started.
 



 At Husqvarna Group, innovation is in our DNA. With over 330 years of heritage and a passion for pioneering technology, we design and deliver world-class products and solutions for forest, park, garden and construction care. From robotic lawn mowers to cutting-edge chainsaws and sustainable battery systems, we’re shaping the future — and we want you to be part of it.
 



  





**About the team** 




 You’ll join an engaged and capable People & Organisation (P&O) Operations team responsible for HR service delivery across the Nordic and Baltic region. The function includes around 30 professionals within Talent Acquisition, Employer Branding, People Partnering, Payroll, Learning & Development, and Health, Safety & Environment. Sweden is the largest and most mature market with 3,500 employees, while other Nordic and Baltic countries are smaller and primarily sales-focused.
 



  





 The team is on an exciting transformation journey – moving towards a more digitalized, efficient and globally aligned operating model. Engagement is high, progress has been made, and there is a strong commitment to continuous improvement and collaboration.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As P&O Operations Director, Nordic & Baltic, you will lead and further develop the shared service center and play a key role in shaping the future of HR operations in the region. The role reports to the VP People & Organisation and carries full responsibility for strategic direction, leadership, and operational excellence across the function.
 



 You will drive transformation and change management, ensuring that HR processes are efficient, scalable, and aligned with both local needs and global strategies. Close collaboration with Global Business Services (GBS) in Poland and global HR teams will be essential to build integrated, end-to-end people processes.
 



  





 Key responsibilities include:
 


* Lead and develop the P&O Operations Nordic/Baltic team, setting clear goals, structures, and collaboration models.
* Implement and adapt the global HR Operating Model to regional needs.
* Ensure compliant, digitalized, and efficient HR processes.
* Drive change management and continuous improvement initiatives.
* Act as a strategic partner to business leaders, GBS, and trade unions.
* Manage budget and resources effectively.
* Actively contribute to driving operational excellence initiatives in a global context together with P&O operations management team.



  





**About you** 




 You are an experienced and inspiring HR leader who thrives in complex, changing environments. You combine strategic vision with hands-on operational understanding and have a strong ability to build trust, engagement, and alignment across diverse teams and stakeholders.
 



 You are a natural communicator who can navigate both local and global contexts, manage ambiguity, and drive transformation with clarity and purpose.
 



  





**Your skills and background** 



* Proven experience in leading and developing HR teams in both local and multinational environments.
* Strong track record in transformation, change management, and stakeholder engagement.
* Strong expertise in managing and optimizing of the full employee life cycle and HR processes. Proven understanding of the end-to-end employee life cycle and people processes.
* Experience in standardizing and digitalizing HR operations, preferably within a shared service setup.
* Strong collaboration skills with functions such as GBS, Total Rewards, and trade unions.
* Solid knowledge of labor law and experience from blue-collar environments.
* Experience in HR systems, preferably Workday and ServiceNow, data-driven decision-making, and ideally automation or AI-driven HR solutions.
* Fluent in Swedish and English (both written and spoken).
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field.



  





**Location** 




 This position will be based at one of our sites in Sweden: Huskvarna, Stockholm, or Jonsered, with a presence in Huskvarna at least 2 days a week.
 



 With our hybrid working environment, you’ll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members.
 



  





**Your application** 




 This is an exciting time to join Husqvarna Group — apply as soon as possible, as we review applications on a rolling basis. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruitment consultant at &Partners: helena.ekdahl@andpartners.se or +46 70 691 90 86.
 



 You’ll join a Swedish company in a global context — with a flat structure, innovative mindset, and strong belief in collaboration. We offer the opportunity to make a real impact: to shape the next generation of HR operations, contribute to an evolving global model, and take HR to its next level of excellence.
 



  





**Winning Through Culture** 




 We believe that business is ultimately about people — as a team, we win and grow together. Our culture is built on bold ideas, strong commitment, and a shared purpose, creating an environment where innovation thrives, people grow, and every contribution matters.

title: Android/iOS Engineer - Automation and GenAI
description:
Join our Client Platform studio and help shape the future of developer experience by building automation and GenAI solutions for Android and iOS platforms. You’ll work with a passionate team focused on making our tools smarter and easier to use - while driving the next wave of innovation in mobile development. If you’re excited about transforming how client engineers build, this is the place to be.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to design, build, and optimize infrastructure that leverages automation and Generative AI for Android or iOS.
* Lead hands-on experiments, rapidly testing hypotheses to improve how client engineers work.
* Drive the adoption of GenAI and machine learning in our development workflows, and help shape build vs. buy strategies for new solutions.
* Mentor team members, encourage best practices, and foster a culture of learning and innovation around GenAI.
* Stay plugged into industry trends and share GenAI insights and opportunities across teams at Spotify.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You know how to build and maintain high-quality Android or iOS apps, and care deeply about developer experience.
* You are experienced with machine learning frameworks, automation tools, and GenAI technologies.
* You have a deep understanding of platform and infrastructure development challenges on mobile.
* You care about fast, hypothesis-driven experimentation and continuous improvement.
* You have strong communication skills and enjoy collaborating across teams.
* (Bonus) You have experience with data pipelines and instrumentation.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code utilizing ARM templates/JSON
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st and 2nd interview with Heidi Storm & Technical Lead from the team
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: Store Manager (m/w/d) - Stockholm, Kista
description:
**Stockholm | Kista Galleria | Full-Time**
**You love jewelry, people – and the magic that happens when both come together?**
 Then this could be your
 *perfect match* 
 ! At our Pandora store, you’ll not only be surrounded by sparkle – you’ll also be the backbone of an amazing team, creating unforgettable customer experiences every single day.
   

  

**We Care – Our Benefits**
* A strong, supportive team and a truly welcoming atmosphere
* 25 vacation days + 1 extra day off on your birthday
* Special leave days for personal events
* Attractive employee discounts on our jewelry
* team bonus program
* Dream Conference – our annual Northern Europe cluster event
* Christmas Dinner
* Ongoing development through training, e-learning & talent programs
* Flexible working: 1 day/month work from home
* "Pandorians refer Pandorians" – Employee Referral Program
* Development opportunities within an international company


**We Deliver – Your Role**
* You lead and develop your team with passion and empathy
* You create unforgettable shopping experiences and present our products in the best possible way
* You’re responsible for recruiting and developing the store team
* You keep an eye on KPIs, processes, and targets – and successfully manage store performance
* You contribute ideas to daily store life – from product presentation to on-the-floor training
* You stay organized, prioritize tasks, delegate effectively, and keep a cool head – even during high-traffic periods


**We Dream – Your Profile**
* Experience in a leadership role in retail is an advantage (ideally in lifestyle, fashion, or jewelry)
* Pleasure in dealing with people
* Analytical mindset and confident working with KPIs and reporting tools
* Proficiency in MS Office (Outlook, Excel, MS Teams, etc.)
* Knowledge of English


**We Dare – Ready for your next career move?**
 Then become a Pandorian! Apply easily via our careers portal.
   

  

 Find out more about us as an employer at:
 **pandoragroup.com**
**About Pandora**
 Pandora is the world’s largest jewelry brand. The company designs, manufactures, and markets hand-finished jewelry made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewelry is sold in more than 100 countries through over 6,800 points of sale – including 2,700 concept stores.
   

  

 Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewelry using only recycled silver and gold. Committed to sustainability, Pandora aims to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its full value chain by 2030.
   

  

 Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.
   

  

 The Financial Times ranked Pandora as one of the best workplaces in Europe, placing it #1 among Danish companies.
   

  

 We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse working environment. We believe that the diversity of society should be reflected in how we engage with our customers – to truly fulfill our purpose:
 **Giving a voice to people’s loves** 
 . We cultivate a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

title: Assistant Product Manager - Solna
description:
Location
   

  

 Solna, SE
   

  

 Vill du arbeta i ett mycket samarbetsinriktat och affärsdrivet team i en internationell miljö, med möjlighet att arbeta med marknadsledande och uppskattade varumärken på den svenska marknaden?
   

  

 Vi söker en Assistant Product Manager för våra kategorier Specialost (dessertost) och Yellow Cheese (påläggsost) till Arla Sveriges marknadsteam i Stockholm. Du rapporterar till Senior Category Manager för BSM & SPC, men kommer även att arbeta 50% med att stötta Hårdost-kategorin med Kvibille samt deras private label-verksamhet.
   

  

 Arlas dessert- och påläggsostar är välkända och konsumeras ofta av svenska konsumenter genom lokala och globala varumärken som Kvibille® och Castello®.
   

  

 Vi befinner oss på en spännande tillväxtresa och behöver drivna, energiska och innovativa personer som kan ta vår kategori till nästa nivå.
   

  

**Hur du gör skillnad**
 Som Assistant Product Manager samarbetar du nära med Brand och Product Managers i utvecklingen av vår portfölj. Du kommer även att samarbeta med ett brett nätverk av intressenter inom Marknad, Försäljning, Innovation och Supply Chain. Du levererar enligt lokala planer och våra ambitiösa tillväxtmål. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara en utmärkt samarbetspartner och koordinator, ha ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt och vara noggrann. Rollen innefattar administrativa uppgifter med tydliga deadlines i många olika system, så det är avgörande att du är strukturerad och bra på planering och självledarskap.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Driva och delta i projekt, processer och rutiner för att nå operativa mål och servicenivåer som är avgörande för affärsleveransen.
* Ett viktigt fokus är att driva produkt- och förpackningsrelaterade aktiviteter såsom lanseringar och förändringar av produkter och förpackningar.
* Driva lönsamhet och nettointäktstillväxt inom portföljen genom optimering.
* Stötta strategisk riktning baserat på konsument- och kategoriinsikter samt utveckla planer för att växa Arlas affär.
* Samarbeta och koordinera med Brand Manager och Produktchef för att optimera portföljen.
* Bygga starka relationer med interna tvärfunktionella team över Arla Foods – exempelvis nära samarbete med supply chain, mejerier och försäljning för att genomföra gemensamma projekt.


**Vad gör dig framgångsrik**
 Vi söker dig som har 2–3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom företagsekonomi, livsmedel eller marknadsföring. Rollen passar dig som redan har viss erfarenhet och vill ta nästa steg, men kan också vara en instegsroll för dig som har relevant bakgrund.
   

  

 Du har god systemvana, är noggrann och strukturerad och har lätt för att planera och prioritera. Du gillar att arbeta självständigt och ta initiativ, är inte rädd för att ta kontakt med olika personer och ser lösningar där andra ser problem. Som kollega är du omtänksam och stöttande teamspelare som bidrar till att skapa en positiv atmosfär.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du**
* Har en relevant akademisk bakgrund, exempelvis högskole- eller universitetsexamen
* Besitter erfarenhet av administration och projektledning
* Visar god systemvana och arbetar strukturerat
* Tar initiativ, är flexibel och trivs med att lösa problem
* Kommunicerar tydligt och rör dig obehindrat mellan många kontaktytor
* Bidrar som en stark lagspelare och har förmåga att påverka andra
* Uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Vi satsar på professionell utveckling och intern karriärväg och erbjuder dig frihet och ansvar. Vår positiva och samarbetsinriktade kultur kommer att lyfta fram det bästa hos dig. Du blir en del av en marknadsledare som producerar näringsrika och uppskattade varumärken på ett sätt som är positivt för våra kunder, de lantbrukare som äger oss och för hela världen. Du ansluter till ett ambitiöst team som betonar samarbete, ledarskap och inkludering, och som arbetar passionerat för tillväxt.
   

  

 Arla Foods har kollektivavtal, och vi säkerställer alltid att erbjuda goda och konkurrenskraftiga arbetsvillkor. Utöver detta är säkerhet och arbetsmiljö våra topp-prioriteringar, vilket innebär att vi bland annat utför slumpmässiga drog- och alkoholtester.
   

  

 Ansökan och kontakt
   

  

 Vi gör löpande urval och tillsätter tjänsten så snart vi har hittat rätt kandidat, men ansökningsperioden stänger 2025-11-24. Vid frågor, kontakta rekryterande chef Hanna Wennerdal på hanwe@arlafoods.com .
   

  

**We have a purpose for Good**
 At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?
   

  

***BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD***
*It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this* 
*link* 
*.*
**Shape the Future of Dairy**
 Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to enabling good food choices that make life better, providing people with natural, sustainable nourishment, while taking care at every step to ensure Arla is a choice they can feel good about. If you are looking to shape the future with an ambitious global cooperative that truly cares about your growth, where everyone feels valued and empowered, and collaboration is the core of culture, Arla is a choice you can feel good about.
   

  

 Ref. 104640
   

  

  

  

**Job Segment** 
 Category Manager, Retail

title: Commerical Internship - LDB (SE)
description:
Are you studying marketing, business administration, communication, branding or similar? Do you have an internship-course coming up in your studies and want to kick-start your career in an innovative and international environment? Our skilled colleagues within L’Oréal Dermatological Beuaty are looking for students to guide, develop, and challenge! If you are ready for this challenge - then we can’t wait to hear from you!
   

  

 Your mission…
   

  

 As an intern in L’Oréal Sweden, you will be welcomed as a full member of a team. You will have your own scope and responsibilities, but you will of course not be alone: Your manager will always provide you with support, objectives, and a clear vision. However, to succeed, you will need to keep in mind that you play the main part in your own success and future projection. Entrepreneurial spirit is key!
   

  

 You will...
   

  

* Support our Commercial team with category growth and development
* Support our Commercial team by identifying and leveraging growth opportunities in collaboration with our retailer partners through market analysis and actionable category insights
* Support our Commercial team with category elevation projects to increase sales and brand presence
* Support our Commercial team with analyzing category performance and gather category shopper insights
* Support our Commercial team with local market RGM projects (pricing, promo policies, conjoints etc)
* Support our Commercial team with various ad hoc projects


 You are...
   

  

* A pro-active team player and not afraid to take ownership of own projects.
* Comfortable with numbers and have an eye for business analytics
* Thriving in a global fast-paced environment, and having a flexible and agile mentality
* Having a strong interest in learning and developing your business understanding
* Experienced within MS Office Package i.e., Outlook, PowerPoint, and Excel
* Having a digital mindset
* You are currently studying and have an approved internship as a part of your studies. (Kindly note that we will need documentation of this from your university)
* You are preferably studying a bachelor's or master's degree in marketing, Communication, Economics, Business Administration, Brand Management or similar
* You are fluent in both Swedish and English


 Please note that to be considered for this internship you need to be attending an internship-course this coming fall as a part of your studies. You must get school credits from doing the internship. The minimum period is 3 months.
   

  

 We are looking for new Marketing interns to start this coming spring 2026. The internship is fix-term and located in our Sweden office in Alvik, Stockholm. We are reviewing applications and inviting for interviews on a rolling basis, so don't hesitate to apply! We welcome everyone to apply for a position at L’Oréal no matter your gender, ethnicity, physical abilities, religion, or sexual orientation.
   

  

 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 From the start, you'll have great responsibility, challenges, and opportunities, including an individual career plan and coaching leadership. Enjoy extensive training, competitive benefits, modern offices, and a dynamic, international working environment with engaged and skilled colleagues. Our Nordic organization includes nearly 1000 employees across the four Nordic capitals.
   

  

 Who are we?
   

  

 Leading the world in beauty and beauty tech, we are over 90,000 employees across 150 countries with 37 international brands. In 2024, the Group generated €43.48 billion in sales. We deliver innovation and digital solutions, embracing entrepreneurship. For 115 years, we've devoted ourselves to fulfilling beauty aspirations worldwide. With 21 research centers globally and a dedicated team of over 4,000 scientists and 8,000 Digital talents, L’Oréal is focused on the future of beauty and becoming a Beauty Tech powerhouse.
   

  

 Freedom to Go Beyond. That's the Beauty of L'Oréal.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Inom Data och Analys arbetar vi med att bygga, förvalta och vidareutveckla tekniska lösningar åt våra interna kunder. Just nu är vårt fokus att skapa en ny, modern analysplattform som samlar Folksams all analysdata på ett ställe. Det ger våra interna kunder tillgång till kraftfulla verktyg och bättre beslutsstöd.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en erfaren Analytics Engineer som vill vara med och forma både plattformen och våra arbetssätt. Välkommen till Folksam – där du växer och gör skillnad.
 



  





**Det här gör du som Analytics Engineer inom Data & Analys på Folksam** 




 Som Analytics Engineer har du en nyckelroll i att forma och optimera hur vi informationsförsörjer med data för analys och rapportering. Du arbetar med att harmonisera data till vår gemensamma informationsmodell, transformera data och bygga ett analyslager.
 



  





 Vår analysplattform byggs i Azure/Databricks och vilar på Delta Lake-arkitektur, där du får använda de senaste verktygen. Verktyg som vi använder är exempelvis dbt, Elementary, Airflow, GitLab mm.
 



 Vi jobbar agilt, och du blir en del av ett drivet Scrumteam, där samarbete och innovation står i fokus.
 



  





 I denna roll har du nära kontakt med olika intressenter för att förstå deras behov och krav, där du anpassar din kommunikation efter deras tekniska bakgrund.
 



 Om du brinner för att arbeta med data och vill vara med och bygga något riktigt spännande, då är det här rätt roll för dig!
 



  





 Vill du veta mer vad IT jobbar med på Folksam? Gå in och läs mer här.
 



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vi söker dig som idag arbetar som Analytics Engineer, Data Engineer eller utvecklare inom datawarehouse, och som har drivkraft att tillsammans med ditt team skapa värde för våra interna kunder.
 



  





 Du har flerårig erfarenhet av att jobba med data och analys i en komplex systemmiljö med gedigen erfarenhet av datalager och datamodellering. Din utvecklarbakgrund omfattar arbete med data pipelines, orkestreringsverktyg, databashantering och DevOps-principer.
 



  





 Du är en noggrann och analytisk person som med nyfikenhet tar dig an nya uppgifter. Vi söker dig som gillar utmaningar och problemlösning, är orädd och som kan lyfta blicken och se helheten. Du gillar att lära dig nytt, dela med dig av din kunskap och bidra till ett team där samarbete står i centrum.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har en relevant högskoleutbildning inom data, systemvetenskap, fysik eller motsvarande.
 



  





 Ett absolut krav är att du behärskar såväl svenska som engelska i både tal och skrift.
 



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast 30 november 2025. Intervjuer sker löpande under ansökningstiden, så skicka in din ansökan redan nu.
 



  





 För att söka tjänsten ber vi dig bifoga ditt CV och besvara ett antal frågor som utgår från aktuell kravprofil. Vid första urval kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och dina svar på frågorna. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef Anna-Karin Tallsten, 070-831 65 38.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson 073-423 59 12 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



  





*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Projektanställning dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetssamordnare
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 Trygghet- och säkerhetssektionen söker efter en dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetssamordnare med junior profil. Har du precis studerat juridik, statsvetenskap eller informationssäkerhet? Är du i början av din karriär och söker efter ett utmanande uppdrag?
   

  

 Huddinge kommun erbjuder möjligheten att utveckla dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetsområdet tillsammans med kompetenta medarbetare. Införandet av cybersäkerhetslagen gör att vi nu söker en medarbetare för att stärka upp verksamhetsområdet dataskydd- och informationssäkerhet.
   

  

 Anställningen är en projektanställning 1-2 år.
   

  

 Vi på trygghets- och säkerhetssektionen har ett uppdrag att leda och stödja arbetet med trygghets- och säkerhetsfrågor genom att jobba strategiskt och styrande på ett kommunövergripande plan. Vårt ansvarsområde är brett och syftar till att stärka demokrati och rättssäkerhet. Trygghets- och säkerhetsfrågor är högt prioriterade i Huddinge kommun. Sektionen består av ett tjugotal medarbetare.
   

  

 Denna roll som dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetssamordnare omfattar:
   

  

* Samordna arbetet inom dataskydd såväl på förvaltningen som kommunövergripande.
* Stödja verksamheten med kartläggning av personuppgiftsbehandlingar.
* Stödja verksamheten med att identifiera, rapportera och åtgärda dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetsrisker.
* Stödja verksamheten med olika typer av analyser, exempelvis konsekvensbedömningar avseende dataskydd och dataöverföringar (Transfer Impact Assessments), intresseavvägningar vid kamerabevakning och informationshanteringsplaner.
* Risk- och konsekvensbedömningar.
* Utveckla, uppdatera och ta fram rutiner, processer och styrdokument kopplat till dataskydd och informationssäkerhet.
* Hantera inkommande ärenden i samråd med kollegor.


 Omvärldsbevakning, nätverkande och kunskapsinhämtning rörande dataskyddsförordningen, cybersäkerhetslagen, olika direktiv och annan närliggande lagstiftning ingår som en viktig del i arbetet. Du kommer också att arbeta nära IT-säkerhetssamordnare, för att säkerställa ett helhetsperspektiv avseende cybersäkerhet.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen bör du vara driven och kunna arbeta självständigt, ha förmåga att arbeta systematiskt och kunna prioritera arbetsuppgifter på ett effektivt sätt.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom juridik, statsvetenskap, informationssäkerhet eller annat område som bedöms relevant för tjänsten.
* Har ett intresse för och kunskap om dataskydd och informationssäkerhet.
* Vi ser även att du är bra på och tycker om att förklara komplexa frågeställningar och situationer på ett enkelt sätt.
* Det ses som meriterande om du har erfarenhet från offentlig verksamhet eller andra stora, komplexa organisationer.


 Då du kommer att arbeta kommunövergripande behöver du vara intresserad av att lära känna kommunens kärnverksamhet och förstå hur personuppgifter och information behandlas i koncernen. Vi tror att du är en kommunikativ person med en förmåga att engagera andra, vilket vi tror är viktigt för att kunna sprida information och etablera en dataskydd- och informationssäkerhetskultur inom organisationen.
   

  

**Om arbetsplatsen** 
 I Huddinge kommun arbetar vi för att skapa ett hållbart samhälle, där natur, teknik och god service samspelar. Huddinge är en stor Stockholmskommun med cirka 6 400 medarbetare och fler än 110 000 invånare. Hos oss känner du dig trygg, delaktig och stolt när vi med kraft gör skillnad, varje dag.
 **Facklig kontaktperson**
 För facklig kontaktperson för tjänsten se Facklig kontaktinformation
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök senast: 2025-11-19
   

  

 Referensnummer: C285791
   

  

**Anställning**
 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 1
   

  

*Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.*

title: Seasonal Educator | STOCKHOLM, NK
description:
**Requirements**
**Description & Requirements**
**Who We Are:**
 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Educator role is the foundation of our success as an organization. Educators are experts in creating world-class customer service, or guest experience, in our retail stores. They are responsible for engaging and connecting with our guests, sharing top-quality product education, and speaking authentically about our community and culture.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Of The Job**
**Guest (i.e., Customer) Experience**
* Interact with guests to ensure a great guest experience in a manner that values guests’ time.
* Assess guests’ needs to provide customized, effective purchase and return solutions and support.
* Provide technical product education by articulating the value and benefit of the product.
* Facilitate a seamless end-to-end guest experience by conducting accurate and timely guest transactions and executing market-relevant omnichannel programs (e.g., buy online/pickup in store, phone sales, and ship from store options) according to company standards.
* Move dynamically on the floor to continuously engage with guests and attend to guest or store needs.
* Receive guest feedback and partner with store leadership to take appropriate action and “make it right” for guests.


**Working With Others**
* Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for all team members and guests.
* Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure optimal guest experience and support store operations.


**Operations**
* Perform product presentation tasks (e.g., put items back in place, restock or add depleted items to the floor from inventory, destock or relocate items) according to company standards.
* Use in-store technology to support store operations and provide positive guest experiences.
* Perform cleaning tasks as needed throughout the shift to maintain the luxury environment of the store.
* Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
* Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.


**Key Skills & Core Values You Bring**
* Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences
* Integrity/Honesty: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner
* Guest Experience: Enjoys working and connecting with, understanding, and helping guests
* Personal Responsibility: Accepts responsibility/accountability for actions; is dependable
* Self-Awareness: Is aware of how words or actions may be perceived by or affect others
* Collaboration and Teamwork: Works productively with others to achieve goals; seeks diverse perspectives
* Enthusiasm: Is enthusiastic about one’s own work; looks for ways to make work fun and engaging


**Job Requirements**
**Eligibility**
* Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located
* Must be 18 years of age or older
* Must have proof of the Right to Work and evidence relating to associated local legislative requirements (EMEA only)
* Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with own transportation methods


**Availability**
* Willing to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and holidays


**Other Willingness Requirements**
* Willing to work in an environment with bright lights and loud music
* Willing to move through a store for most of a shift to help guests and accomplish work
* Willing to move boxes weighing up to 30 lbs (13.6 kg)
* Willing to work as part of a team and also complete some work independently


**Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)**
* Education: High school diploma, GED, or equivalent


 In keeping with our mission, please connect with us at accommodations@lululemon.com if you have questions about how your unique abilities may translate to the requirements for this role, with or without a reasonable accommodation. In your email, please include the position title, the location of the position and the nature of your question or request.
   

  

**Beyond The Paycheck (Benefits & Perks)**
 At lululemon, we care for and invest in the whole person – body, mind, spirit. Our total rewards program is designed to support you in achieving your goals and focus on the things you love. In addition to competitive base pay and a team-based bonus program, we also offer extended health plans, paid time off, savings plans, generous employee discounts, fitness/yoga classes, parenthood top up program and personal and professional development programs.
   

  

 Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

title: Azure Cloud Specialist
description:
Brinner du för molninfrastruktur och vill bidra till en hållbar och modern IT-miljö inom en samhällsviktig verksamhet i Stockholm?
 



  





 Vi söker nu en Azure Cloud Specialist som vill arbeta med avancerad teknik i en organisation som kombinerar trygghet och långsiktighet med innovation och framtidstänk. Som nyckelperson i vår kunds satsning på en smart och effektiv hybridmiljö får du möjligheten att både påverka strategiska vägval och vara hands-on i utvecklingen av deras molnplattform.
 



  





 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag där tanken är att anställningen senare ska gå över till vår kund.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Azure Cloud Specialist blir du en del av vår kunds infrastrukturteam med hög teknisk kompetens. Du arbetar nära verksamheten och arkitekter för att implementera, drifta och vidareutveckla molnbaserade infrastruktur, både i Azure och on-prem-miljö.
 



  





 Du bidrar till att säkerställa att allt fungerar på ett effektivt, säkert och framtidssäkrat sätt.
 



  





*Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:* 



* Implementera och utveckla molnbaserade infrastrukturlösningar i Azure
* Stödja och utveckla hybridinfrastrukturen i nära samarbete med teamet
* Arbeta med säkerhetslösningar, automation, kostnadsoptimering och nya funktioner i molnplattformen



  





**Din profil** 




  





*Krav:* 



* Minst 7 års erfarenhet i liknande roller
* Certifiering inom Microsoft Azure (t.ex. Azure Administrator Associate eller Security Engineer Associate)
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom Azure-plattformens kärnkomponenter: Compute, nätverk, lagring, identitet, säkerhet och automation
* Erfarenhet av Azure Virtual Desktop, Application Gateway, Application Proxy och Intune
* Vana vid hybridmiljöer och god kännedom om kostnadsstyrning i Azure
* Färdigheter i PowerShell och hantering av Conditional Access
* Erfarenhet av Entra ID och Active Directory
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





*Meriterande:* 



* Kunskap inom DNS, Linuxmiljöer, Terraform eller annan IaC-lösning
* Erfarenhet av certifikatshantering, PKI, ADCS



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.

title: Operations Client Coordinator - Corporate
description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Operations team working in the
 **Corporate** 
 segment at Marsh. This role will be based in
 **Stockholm.** 
 This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.
   

  

 As our new Client Coordinator, you will be part of the continuous journey towards building a strong and professional Operations team in Stockholm, Sweden. The Operations team handles several administrative tasks related to the insurance matters of our clients, as well as supports our business colleagues in their daily servicing of our clients.
   

  

 Our highest priority is to ensure that our deliverables to our colleagues and clients are at the expected standard and requirements and of course always within the timeframe given to us. Our goal is to ensure efficient and professional service delivery, to support the successes and growth of our business.
   

  

**Please note: if applying please ensure that your CV & application is in English.**
**We will rely on you to:**
* Support with the renewal of our small and mid-size clients.
* Together with our service hub support the renewal of some of our facility solutions.
* Handling the ongoing service of our clients.
* Supporting client executives in building and formatting reports and presentations for our clients
* Maintenance of client information
* Working together with our colleagues in our shared service centre in Poland around invoicing, document intake and archiving


**What you need to have:**
* Work experience from a similar position within the insurance or broker industry
* Fluent in Swedish and English (oral and written)
* Experienced user of Microsoft Office tools, in particular Excel
* Flair for IT systems


 As a person, you have excellent interpersonal skills and are able to work within a team. You are analytical and structured in your way of working. You have a flexible and pro-active mindset and meet deadlines.
   

  

**What makes you stand out:**
* Work experience of 1-2 years in a similar role in the financial services industry.
* Education at minimum Bachelor level
* IDD licence


**Why join our team:**
* We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
* We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues and clients.
* Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.


 #hybrid
   

  

 Marsh, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is the world’s top insurance broker and risk advisor. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit marsh.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
   

  

**R\_321099**

title: Strategic Key Account Manager
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated
 **Key Account Manager** 
 to join our team at our headquarters in Stockholm. In this role, you will take ownership of some of our most valuable merchant relationships within e-commerce. You will strengthen partnerships, drive growth, and ensure long-term success, while also leading complex projects and initiatives. We are looking for someone who can challenge partners and clients in a constructive way, delivering real value to all stakeholders and making a measurable impact on the business.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Manage and grow a portfolio of strategic accounts, developing tailored strategies to maximize revenue and profitability.
* Build and maintain senior-level client relationships, ensuring needs are met and expectations consistently exceeded.
* Identify and capture new business opportunities while adapting solutions to evolving client needs.
* Lead contract negotiations, securing mutually beneficial agreements.
* Analyse sales data and market trends to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver exceptional client outcomes.
* Provide regular reports on account performance and communicate effectively with senior management.


**What We're Looking For**
 In order to be successful in this role, you have proven experience in a similar role, ideally within e-commerce or last-mile logistics. You bring a mix of strategic vision and hands-on execution, with a consultative approach that challenges clients and creates real value. As you can see we’re looking for someone outstanding and when we review your profile, we’ll look for evidence of:
   

  

* A bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field.
* 7+ years of experience in key account management, or project management
* Demonstrated project leadership experience, managing complex client initiatives end to end.
* A strong track record of exceeding targets and growing key accounts.
* Proven experience negotiating with and managing relationships at C-level.
* Experience in logistics and/or e-commerce (highly advantageous).
* Exceptional communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Proficiency with CRM systems and sales reporting tools.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both verbal and written.


**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with our people, the merchants and our consumers at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Är du en nyexaminerad tech talang och vill jobba på en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsplatser? Nu har du chansen att starta din karriär hos ICA! Här får du kombinera modern teknik med affär, växa i ett engagerat team och jobba med finansapplikationer.
 



  





**Om rollen och teamet** 




  





 I rollen som Platform Engineer blir du en del av ett tvärfunktionellt team som ansvarar för underhåll och förvaltning av finansapplikationer. Teamet arbetar med applikationer som bland annat hanterar finansiell rapportering, bokslutsprocesser och bankintegrationer på ICA. Arbetet sker i LowCode-system, där utvecklingen främst sker genom applikationskomponenter och stödjande script i SQL.
 



 Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter innefattar arbete med incidenthantering, systemlösningar, integrationer, konfigurationer och behörighetsadministration. Du ansvarar även för att säkerställa behovs- och kravuppfyllnad samt hantera olika tekniska gränssnitt. Utöver detta kommer du att arbeta med backlog-hantering och dokumentation.
 



  





**Att jobba med tech på ICA** 




  





 Ser du också möjligheterna med digital innovation? Vi tycker att det är bland det bästa som hänt vår bransch. För det gör att vi kan förenkla vardagen för så många människor därute. I nära samarbeten med varandra, för att verkligen kunna maximera allas individuella insatser i varje utmaning vi möter, skapar vi riktig kundnytta. Oavsett om vi jobbar med IT inom banktjänster, fastigheter eller kring all vår goda mat är vi nära kundens vardag. Och vi driver den digitala utvecklingen framåt inom våra olika områden. Varje dag.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




  




* Du har en kandidat-, master- eller civilingenjörsutbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annan relevant inriktning.
* Du har grundläggande kunskaper i SQL och ett genuint intresse för finansområdet.
* Du har förståelse för API:er, molntjänster och integrationer.
* Du vill arbeta i en teknisk verksamhetsnära roll, där du får kombinera teknik med affärsförståelse.
* Du är kommunikativ, nyfiken, ödmjuk och driven. Trivs med att arbeta i team och förstår vikten av samarbete, kunskapsdelning och gemensamma mål.
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





**Start för konsultuppdraget:** 
 Omgående
 



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 Låter det här som en intressant möjlighet för dig? Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag då vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail på grund av GDPR. Om du har några frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen eller programmet, vänligen kontakta Ender Kökat på ender.kokat@guidedtalentsolutions.se
 



  





**Att vara konsult på Guided Talent Solutions** 




  





 Guided Talent Solutions matchar techtalanger med Sveriges främsta företag. För den här rollen kommer du att bli anställd av Guided Talent Solutions, men arbeta hos vår kund ICA. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos ICA.

title: Go-To-Market
description:
**Ready to shape Intric's growth at the frontline of sales and marketing?**
 Join Intric as a Go-To-Market and play a vital part in accelerating our expansion. Intric is a fast-growing tech startup leading the AI revolution in the public sector. At Intric, you won't just follow instructions, you'll get the chance to drive projects, experiment new ideas, and see your work directly influence the company. This role blends smart sales outreach with digital marketing and data-driven lead generation.
   

  

 Intric is accelerating its growth, backed by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers. We're looking for a driven and curious mind to join our growing team in Stockholm.
   

  

**About Intric:**
 Intric is a fast-growing AI technology company on a mission to make AI accessible, scalable and secure for Europe's most important organisation. Our platform is transforming how work is done, primarily in the public sector and enterprises that prioritise data sovereignty, by making AI accessible to a wider audience so that they can focus on what's really important: Creating positive impact and lasting change.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
 To be honest, with our lightning speed growth, no two days are the same. As a Go-To-Market, you'll operate at the intersection of marketing and sales, executing the tasks that it takes to accelerate Intric's lead generation. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and want to make an impact, this is your opportunity. A key focus is experiment with growth tactics and refine our outreach and marketing strategies, combining sales and marketing to deliver an exceptional lead generation strategy.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* We think you have 1-2 years of experience in similar roles or demonstrable achievements in relevant areas. Experience with a startup is considered extra relevant.
* Passionate about sales, business development and interested in AI.
* Solution-oriented with an entrepreneurial spirit who gets things done.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English. Proficiency in other European languages is considered a plus, but not a requirement.
* Social, driven, and eager to learn new things.


**What We Offer**
* Be part of shaping the future of AI, creating real and positive impact on public sector and enterprise leaders and solving real-world challenges.
* The chance to be an integral part of shaping a company's growth strategies.
* Every voice matters, get the chance to bring your ideas to life, take ownership of projects and see your ideas come to life.
* You'll be part of a supportive team that values experimentation and initiative.
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector.
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options.

title: Team Lead Development
description:
**About The Role**
**The Role:** 
 Team Lead Development
   

  

**The Team:** 
 A focused team of highly talented technologists, based in Stockholm, with strong skills across technology; development, UI, devops, testing, automation. The team is empowered and expected to make the technical decisions needed to deliver robust, great-looking products that meet customer needs, and they work closely with other parts of the organisation to achieve this. Everyone on the team is responsible for all parts of the system being built, run, and supported, making it an ideal place for a leader who wants to expand their own technical skillset as well as grow as a leader by coaching team members. The team values learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.
   

  

 The team is responsible for designing, building, running and supporting several products within the Trade Lifecycle division.
   

  

**The Impact:** 
 The team lead plays an important role in the success of the company, both directly through the achievements, learning and improvements of their own team, but also by driving change in tools and processes used in other parts of the technology organisation as well as by creating and facilitating cross-team collaborations. The lead will directly contribute to building the product, delivering code together with the Team.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
* Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
* Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
* Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including but not limited to Container Orchestration Systems, relational and NoSQL databases,Java, Golang, and Python)
* Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)
* Grow as a leader through collaborations with other leaders
* Work on market-leading solutions with people across the globe


**Responsibilities**
* Foster a positive and collaborative team environment which embodies the company culture
* Take technical ownership of the products built, run, and supported by the team
* Provide guidance and mentorship to individuals and team to achieve their goals
* Create and ensure adherence to coding standards, guidelines, and best practices
* Manage tech partnerships with internal & external vendors
* Schedule and participate in the on call support


**What We’re Looking For**
* Strong development skills (architecting/designing/building)
* Strong ownership and responsibility traits
* Wide experience from working in software development teams
* Excellent communication skills
* Business mindedness and a solution-oriented mindset
* An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself and others
* Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week
* 7+ years of software development experience


**We’d Also Prefer It If You Have**
* A proven track record of managing a small team
* Experience in leading at least one technical project
* An interest in financial markets
* Experience with Elm (Frontend)


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert**
 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 322450
