title: DevOps Engineer VX Fiber
description:
**VX Fiber is looking for a DevOps Engineer.** Do you want to help us design and run the backbone of a future-proof SaaS platform, and make your mark in a small but global team? Then you might be the one we’re looking for.

About the Role

As a DevOps Engineer in our **Platform Team**, you will help build and operate the foundation that all our applications run on. The team owns VX Fiber’s hybrid-cloud **Application Platform** based on **Nomad, Consul, Vault, and Terraform**. We aim for **immutable infrastructure, self-service deployments, and a platform that is stable, observable, and secure** – enabling our developers to spend their time coding, not firefighting.

You will work in a **self-organizing**, **cross-functional team** where **architecture**, **automation**, and **infrastructure-as-code** are everyday topics. This role combines deep technical responsibility with the freedom to explore and improve how things should be done.

What you'll Do

* Design, build, and evolve our **application platform and service mesh**
* Develop **CI/CD pipelines and developer tooling** that reduce lead time to production
* Create and manage **golden images** and drive our shift to **immutable infrastructure**
* Operate and maintain **platform applications** (databases, monitoring, message queues, proxies, etc.)
* Implement **observability and monitoring** so issues are visible and diagnosable
* Take part in **architecture decisions and system design** for new solutions

What we offer you

* **Meaningful work** – contribute to societal change through digital infrastructure
* **Technical innovation** – work with the latest in the HashiCorp ecosystem and cloud technology
* **Growth culture** – curiosity and responsibility are rewarded with real autonomy
* **Global context** – work with colleagues from different parts of the world in a cross-functional team
* **Real collaboration** – we build, learn, and grow together

What you BringEducation

We value **competence**, **drive**, and **pragmatism** more than formal education – if you have the right experience, a diploma matters less.

Experience

* Solid experience with **Linux systems** and **shell scripting** (bash, zsh)
* Comfortable with containerization technology such as **Docker** or **Kubernetes**
* Good understanding of **Infrastructure as Code**, preferably with **Terraform**
* Used to working independently and taking responsibility for the whole process – from design to operations
* Interest in or experience with **CI/CD** pipelines and automation
* Familiarity with **Nomad, Vault, Consul,** and other HashiCorp tools is a big advantage
* Bonus if you've worked with **large-scale networks** or in the telecom industry
* Knowledge of **Go** or **ReactJS** is a plus

Language

Fluent in English, both spoken and written

About the employment

The position is a permanent full-time role.

Location: Umeå

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible.

Why VX Fiber?

VX Fiber is a Swedish technology company with over 20 years of global experience in fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) and open access networks. Our goal is to create digital freedom for individuals, businesses, and communities by offering reliable, scalable, and sustainable network solutions.

We offer a managed platform that simplifies fibre network operations—from full-stack OSS/BSS to active equipment and field deployment. Our platform is modular, scalable by design, and made to transform.

We connect network owners, service providers, and end-users through an open access model that accelerates time to market, reduces cost, and automates complexity. With proven flexibility and fast onboarding, our technology supports sustainable, future-ready networks.

**VX Fiber – Made to transform. Scalable by design.** 

Apply here --> https://ats.talentadore.com/apply/devops-engineer/8VXWkN

Jobbtyp: Heltid, Tillsvidare

Förmåner:

* Extra semesterdagar
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Livförsäkring
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Tjänstemobil
* Tjänstepension

Arbetsort: På plats

title: DevOps Platform Engineer - 100% Remote (from anywhere in Europe) (m/f/d)
description:
**This position is only available for hiring in Europe. If you are based outside of Europe we can not accept your application.**


Also please note: **ENGLISCH and GERMAN is a MUST** on this position.  

**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***  

  

**Are you an experienced developer or DevOps Engineer? Do you want the freedom to work remotely and want to grow in an internationally successful software and education company? Well, than take the chance and be a part of our DevOps & SRE team :)**

 **Who is Digistore24?**


We are one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe.

**What drives us?** **We shape the digital future!** Our mission is to empower people with our software and expertise to share their knowledge online, enabling them to fulfill their dream of an own business. As a result, millions of people gain access to information that helps them reach their goals. To keep pace with our growth, we aim to expand our teams sustainably. We emphasize working with experts and strong personalities who share our values – regardless of their location.  

  

**Your new dream job**

* **Automation** and Infrastructure as **Code (IaC)**: You automate repetitive tasks, deployments, and system management to reduce human error and improve efficiency. This might involve creating scripts, **CI/CD pipelines**, or automating infrastructure provisioning.
* **Collaboration with Development and SRE Teams**: You work closely with developers and sire reliability engineers to align platform capabilities with application requirements. You provide tools and frameworks that promote best practices in CI/CD, testing and deployment.
* **Reliability and Performance Optimization**: You continuously improve the system uptime by identifying bottlenecks and optimizing system architecture.
* **Capacity Planning and Scaling**: You assess and predict system resource requirements (CPU, memory, storage) to ensure the infrastructure can scale with increasing demand. Implement auto-scaling solutions to handle load spikes without human intervention, ensuring systems remain performant under various conditions.
* **System Monitoring and Incident Response**: Continuously monitor system performance, uptime, and reliability using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or ElasticSearch. The goal is to detect and respond to issues before they impact users. Manage and respond to incidents, outages, and failures quickly, aiming to minimize downtime. This includes managing incident documentation, communication, and post-incident analysis.

**Your benefits at Digistore24**

* Work in your **home office**, as long as you can guarantee uninterrupted internet access
* Regular **further education**
* The **stability** of an extremely successful German high-tech company that is **funded by its successful product** and not by investors
* Outcome focused teams and a culture of direct feedback
* **Modern equipment**
* International, **collaborative team** with strong cohesion
* **Spectacular team events** in various European countries
* **Autonomy** from day one
* Work in your **team on a first-name basis**, without a dress code, and at eye level
* **Flexible working hours** from Mondays to Fridays

 **Your superpowers**

* **Communication Mastery**: You communicate precisely and in a recipient-friendly manner. You diffuse potential conflicts with sensitivity and a solution-oriented approach. You always strike the right tone with stakeholders, developers and your team, even under time pressure, and can seamlessly switch from German to English if necessary.
* **Collaboration Wizardry**: You collaborate with developers, stakeholders and operations and bring everyone on the same page. You understand the challenges of different teams and find solutions that benefit the entire company.
* **Automation Sorcery**: You promote automation as a way to save time and reduce errors, and implement tools that improve productivity across the team.
* **Problem-Solving Genius**: You dive deep into problems, identify root causes and come up with solutions that prevent future incidents.
* **Self-organization**: You thrive on autonomy and excel at organizing and structuring complex projects while working from home.
* **Additional MUST HAVE skills:**


	+ Cloud Services (Preferably Google, but AWS is also okay)
	+ Very good experience with Terraform / Terragrunt
	+ Very good experience with Kubernetes / Container Technology
	+ Excellent spelling and grammar in German

**Your typical day at Digistore24**

* **Daily** morning video call to talk to your team about yesterday's progress and today's plans.
* You check the latest **cloud logs and pull requests** and update an IaC module after checking the change-log for breaking changes.
* Then you take a new ticket from the backlog to develop a dashboard solution for a better overview of the system status.
* You discuss different solutions with your colleagues and start writing the code for the solution.
* After your lunch break, a developer needs help with a new CI/CD workflow. You discuss the requirements with him and provide him with an initial prototype.
* You take the ticket to check the resource allocation of an application, check the current utilization and adjust the deployment.
* At the end of the day, you review a colleague’s code changes and approve their pull request.
* You find an endpoint that is not yet included in the monitoring. After creating a ticket for this, you immediately write the code in the Terraform project to add it.

**This position is NOT for you if**

* ... you do not identify with our values
* … you have less than 3 years of experience in IT operations
* … you can’t take ownership and need to discuss every detail with your supervisor or colleagues
* … you have difficulty planning and prioritizing your tasks
* … you don’t like to find solutions for complex problem
* … you are not confident speaking German AND English

**Our values**  

https://careers.digistore24.com/en/culture-and-core-values


Please take a REALLY close look at the values. Are you ready to live them?

title: Tech Lead
description:
At **Ingrid**, we’re building the delivery experience of the future by helping merchants, carriers, and service points make every delivery better. Our products handle real-world complexity at scale, and we take pride in building systems that are reliable, resilient, and thoughtfully designed.


We’re looking for a **Tech Lead** who enjoys being both a builder **and** a leader. Someone who can guide architectural direction, support a growing engineering team, and stay close to the code. If you love solving complex problems, empowering others, and making smart tradeoffs that create meaningful impact, this role is for you.

### **What you’ll do**

* **Shape technical direction:** define architectural decisions that ensure performance, reliability, and scalability while collaborating with our Chief Architect.
* **Lead and support the team:** guide, coach, mentor, and foster ownership and collaboration
* **Drive delivery:** oversee sprint planning, prioritization, and communication with product & design. Ensuring smooth execution and clear communication with product and design partners.
* **Contribute hands-on:** review PRs, solve complex problems, and set coding standards
* **Champion engineering excellence:** CI/CD, observability, automation, knowledge sharing
* **Collaborate cross-functionally:** with product, design, and other tech leads to align vision and execution

### **What you bring**

#### **Experience & Leadership**

* Proven experience as a Tech Lead or similar role guiding engineering delivery
* Ability to balance hands-on coding with planning, prioritization, and mentoring
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build trust and alignment across teams

#### **Technical Skills**

* Strong backend development background, ideally with Go
* Experience building and scaling distributed systems in production
* Knowledge of cloud-native environments (GCP, Kubernetes) and DevOps workflows (Terraform, GitHub Actions)
* Familiarity with observability (Linkerd, Prometheus, Grafana) and data/storage tech (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Google Pub/Sub)
* Comfortable working in continuous delivery environments

#### **Mindset & Approach**

* **Product-drive:** you think in outcomes, not just output. You’ll collaborate closely with PMs to understand the bigger picture, challenge assumptions, and weigh the technical tradeoffs necessary to deliver maximum value to our users, not just complete a ticket.
* **Pragmatic & strategic:** balancing speed, quality, and long-term sustainability.
* **Collaborative:** you thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy bringing others along.
* **Growth-oriented:** curious about emerging technologies, open to learning and improving.
  

### **Nice to have**

* Experience in SaaS, e-commerce, or logistics platforms
* Interest in using AI tools to accelerate development
* Experience mentoring across multiple teams or scaling engineering orgs
* Some exposure to frontend or full-stack environments

### **Why Ingrid**


We’re on a mission to fix the delivery experience. Ingrid connects merchants, carriers, and consumers to create shopping journeys that are smooth, sustainable, and human.


At Ingrid, you’ll find:

* A supportive, friendly team that values trust and autonomy
  
* Flexible work setup. Hybrid in Stockholm or Wroclaw
  
* Competitive compensation, wellness allowance, and pension plan
  
* Opportunity to work with modern tech and contribute to products that make a difference

title: Simulation and SW integration engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

The role requires knowledge and 10+ years of experience in:  

* Object oriented programming - Python / C++
* Integration - connecting different application's interfaces/libraries
* Docker, CMake, Linux environment
* DevOps - Kubernetes, Jenkins

  

**Meritorious**  

* Simulation of ADAS features
* Test and verification
* AUTOSAR - adaptive and classic
* General automotive work, preferably within ADAS and/or Vehicle Dynamics
* Working as a Scrum Master (or Product Owner)

  

**Application deadline:** 13-10-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Non-Functional Test Lead (Industry/IoT & SCADA) (Future assignment)
description:
**Role description**  

You will lead and execute non-functional testing for an industrial IoT platform and SCADA environment with strict requirements on operational reliability, redundancy, and cybersecurity. The role is senior and hands-on, with responsibility from test strategy to results and improvements.

**Responsibilities**

* Define the non-functional test strategy covering performance, capacity, availability, and recovery.
* Establish metrics, SLAs/SLOs, and realistic load scenarios in collaboration with Operations/DevOps.
* Plan and execute load, stress, endurance, and failover tests; analyse bottlenecks and drive remediation with engineering teams.
* Verify monitoring, logging, tracing, and alert chains for production readiness.
* Report findings, risks, and recommendations to stakeholders ahead of pilot and go-live.

**Requirements**

* 5+ years of non-functional testing in complex, distributed environments.
* Proficiency with performance tools such as k6, JMeter, or Gatling, and analysis using APM/monitoring platforms.
* Experience with cloud/SaaS and edge/IoT components, preferably Azure IoT.
* Understanding of OT/IT integration and industrial protocols (e.g., OPC UA, Modbus).
* Familiarity with risk management, business continuity, and release/deployment processes.

**Meriting**

* SCADA/DCS background, redundancy and failover testing.
* Security and network testing in OT environments.
* Infrastructure as Code and performance testing in Kubernetes-based platforms.

**Start / Duration**

* Start: ASAP or by agreement
* Duration: 6–12 months (extension possible)

**Location**

* Finspång

**About Rasulson Consulting**  

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
About Us
  
nShift is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
  
Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!
  
If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.
  
Purpose of Role
  
We’re looking for a proactive, analytical, and detail-oriented Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our high-performing team. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a collaborative environment where you’ll help ensure the stability, performance, and scalability of nShift’s SaaS platform.
  
Your main responsibility will be ensuring the operational availability and reliability of our platform and the underlying infrastructure that supports our customers globally. You’ll work closely with software engineers to configure, monitor, and optimize systems and applications, while continuously seeking opportunities to automate and improve our operations.
  
  

**The area of responsibility includes:**  

All team members share responsibilities related to the operational availability and reliability of the SaaS platform and application support. The duties include:
  
Configuration and maintenance of hosted systems and related infrastructure
  
Configuration and maintenance of applications in close collaboration with software engineers
  
Performance tuning of systems and applications to handle large data volumes and ensure 24/7 availability
  
Monitoring of systems, applications, and services to maintain stability and reliability
  
Troubleshooting of incidents, with ownership up to the OS-application boundary
  
Continuous improvement and optimization of team procedures and operational practices
  
Participating in the on-call rotation outside of office hours
  
Skills and Competencies Proven experience in a similar role (SRE, DevOps, or Systems Engineer) managing Linux-based systems and applications
  
Hands-on experience in automation and scripting for infrastructure, containers, systems, and applications
  
Understanding of the challenges and responsibilities of running a 24/7 operation
  
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
  
Enthusiasm for troubleshooting and using issues as opportunities to learn and improve
  
Fluent written and spoken English
  
Technical Environment - We have a broad toolset in use; any level of working knowledge with one or more of these tools or technologies is a plus: Linux
  
Kubernetes/Rancher/Docker
  
Jenkins/Rundeck
  
Tomcat
  
PostgreSQL/MySQL/SQL Server
  
Splunk
  
RabbitMQ
  
ElasticSearch
  
  

Bonus points
  
Experience in managing an AWS environment, including automation
  
Extensive in-depth experience in any of the tools/technologies mentioned above
  
  

Who You Are
  
Well-organized and have a positive, solution-focused attitude
  
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
  
A collaborative team player with great communication skills
  
Committed to maintaining reliable, high-performance systems that serve our customers globally
  
  

* Please submit your CV in English\*


At nShift, we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone, which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal opportunity employer, meaning all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.
  
#LI-JB1
  
#LI-Hybrid

title: DevOps engineer - Observability
description:
**Providing Value & Impact – SwedQ.**


SwedQ is a consultancy company that has proven to have a unique model for those who want to grow, create a legacy, and take on challenges that both add and gain value. Year after year, we’ve delivered results to clients across multiple industries (intentionally excluding gambling and weaponry). During this time, we’ve also grown steadily—in revenue, in team size, and in the impact of our deliveries.  

  

We’re now looking for a **DevOps engineer - Observability**—someone who doesn’t just monitor systems but builds the foundation that keeps them alive and healthy. Someone who wants to be part of the company in a literal sense. That means taking on complex technical challenges while having the chance to own a piece of SwedQ’s future. You’ll be encouraged to drive your own ideas, improve what exists, and build something lasting—together with us.


You’ll be working closely with engineers, platform specialists, and DevOps teams—making it easy to bring change, innovate, and act on what you believe in.

### **What’s in it for you?**


The question goes back to you: what do you want (with common sense or not)? Some people value fixed salaries, pensions, and stability. Others want a bigger share of the pie and are ready to share the risks. Let’s talk that through.


One thing is certain—we’ll make sure you find your “it,” whether that’s with us in-house or with our clients.


We’ll shape the role to fit both your needs and ours. The good thing? You’ll be surrounded by technically brilliant people—giving you plenty of opportunities to teach, learn, and collaborate. And if not technically, then perhaps in entrepreneurship.


We know—it’s a lot of questions. That’s why we have interviews, right?

### **Who are you**

* 5+ years of experience working with **Kubernetes** in production environments
* Deep understanding of **Prometheus** and **Grafana**, from setup to scaling and tuning
* Strong knowledge of **observability concepts**—metrics, tracing, logging, and alerting
* Hands-on experience with **Infrastructure as Code** (Terraform, Helm, Ansible) and containerization
* Skilled in **Python, Go, or Bash** for automation and tooling
* Experience deploying and maintaining **observability stacks** (Grafana, Prometheus, Thanos, Loki)
* Knowledge of **OpenTelemetry** and distributed tracing best practices
* Understanding of **GPU workloads**, **PBS services**, and **OCP environments** is a plus
* Curious, detail-oriented, and eager to improve reliability at scale

### **SwedQ Culture**


SwedQ began with siblings who brought in people they knew. Those people recommended friends, and from there, the company grew further through open head-hunting. Over time, we’ve built a diverse team with different backgrounds, experiences, and insights.


We’ve amplified this diversity by embracing independence and accountability while focusing on value-creating work. At the same time, we make sure to have fun—with epic football tournaments, unforgettable trips, and great dinners.

### **Perks & Benefits**

* Competitive salary—you decide your preferred salary model
* Budget to spend on health and gym
* Generous development budget (courses, conferences, and certifications)
* Monthly payments into your additional pension fund
* Private health insurance
* Private healthcare
* Office in the city – a stone’s throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
* Breakfast in the SwedQ office EVERYDAY
* Support for open-source projects and community engagement
* Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner
* Company car (or car allowance)
* Benefits to make life easier—home cleaning, childcare, and more

title: Information Security Manager at Prorenata AB
description:
**Are you Prorenata’s new Information Security Manager?**
---------------------------------------------------------


We’re looking for a skilled and hands-on **Information Security Manager** to strengthen and structure our security work across product development and internal operations.


Prorenata develops user-friendly, efficient and engaging tools for professionals who otherwise have to live with outdated, hard-to-use systems. We’ve been profitable for over ten years, are growing quickly, and have our office in central Stockholm.


Our product, **Prorenata Journal**, is a leading electronic health record system for Swedish school health services, used by the absolute majority of Sweden’s municipalities. As such we take pride and make great efforts in our security work.

**About the Role**
------------------


As **Information Security Manager** at Prorenata, you will strengthen and structure our information security efforts across the company. You’ll ensure that our products, systems and processes are designed and operated according to industry standards and best practices.


The role focuses primarily on secure development and architecture (around 70%) while also supporting the company’s broader security management and **ISO 27001** certification (around 30%).

### **Your responsibilities will include:**

* Collaborating on **secure coding**, vulnerability management and dependency control.
* Reviewing **architecture and design decisions** with a focus on security and risk management.
* Maintaining **security guidelines and checklists** for development and DevOps teams.
* Managing and coordinating **information security incidents**.
* Leading the **technical aspects of ISO 27001 certification** and **NIS 2 compliance** together with our Regulatory Affairs Manager.
* Supporting internal information security work, policies, risk assessments and training.
* Ensuring and when needed implementing compliance with relevant frameworks (ISO 27001, NIS 2, OWASP, GDPR, etc).
* Acting as an advisor to the **CTO, COO, CPO and Tech Team Leads**, and serving as a point of contact for external partners on security issues.
* Reporting directly to the CTO (who is also CEO)

### **We’re looking for someone who:**

* Has a **solid background in system development or architecture** within modern web environments.
* Brings **hands-on experience in information security** for software development and operations.
* Understands **cloud security, encryption, networking, authentication and APIs**.
* Can **review code and infrastructure** from a security perspective.
* Is familiar with **secure CI/CD pipelines**, static and dynamic code analysis, and vulnerability management.
* Has experience applying **international security standards and frameworks**.
* Communicates fluently in **English**.

### **It’s a plus if you also have:**

* Experience implementing and maintaining **ISO 27001** or other **ISMS** frameworks.
* Background from **regulated environments** (healthcare, finance, public sector).
* Understanding of **data protection and GDPR**.
* Practical knowledge of **DevSecOps and automated security controls**.
* Interest in **educating and engaging others** in information security.
* Swedish language skills.

### **We offer:**

* A workplace that encourages **professional and personal growth**.
* A **warm and collaborative culture** with genuinely kind and fun colleagues, we believe in community and enjoying the journey.
* A **hybrid work setup**: we value being at the office two to three days a week for collaboration and culture, with flexibility to work from home the rest.
* The chance to work on a **product that makes a real difference** for its users.
* **Competitive salary and generous benefits** including 6 weeks of vacation, retirement fund according to ITP1 and more.


Does this sound like you?  

Submit your application via the link below, we look forward to hearing from you! Applications are reviewed continuously, so apply now and no later than November 28th.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**We are supporting a consultancy in their search for an experienced DevOps / DevSecOps Engineer** 
 to join their high-performing Quality business unit. This team focuses on testing, automation, DevOps, and security within the software delivery lifecycle, and they are looking for a passionate engineer to strengthen both delivery and security capabilities.
 



  





**About You** 




 You’re someone with a natural drive, a passion for Cloud, CI/CD, and secure engineering practices, and a commitment to delivering quality solutions. You enjoy sharing your expertise, embedding security into delivery pipelines, and working collaboratively across teams.
 



  





**Key Skills & Experience:** 



* **Cloud Platforms & Services:** 
 Azure, Azure DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes.
* **Infrastructure as Code & Automation:** 
 Terraform, Salt, Ansible, Chef, Powershell, Bash, Python.
* **Monitoring, Logging & Security:** 
 Datadog, CloudWatch, Prometheus, Splunk, Grafana, ELK, vulnerability scanning, compliance tooling (e.g. Snyk, Aqua, Prisma, or similar).



  





**The Role** 




 You will work as a consultant, embedded in a development team with one of our end clients. Assignments vary but typically include:
 


* Designing, building, and maintaining secure delivery pipelines.
* Managing infrastructure as code and automating deployments.
* Implementing and maintaining DevSecOps practices, including vulnerability management, threat modelling, and compliance automation.
* Configuring, optimising, and maintaining cloud environments with a security-first mindset.
* Collaborating closely with developers, testers, and operations teams to deliver high-quality, secure solutions.



  





**What’s on Offer** 



* A secure, long-term role with strong professional development opportunities.
* Work within a people-focused organisation recognised for outstanding workplace culture.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Access to a collaborative network of DevOps and DevSecOps experts.

title: Junior DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en modern, robust och skalbar utvecklingsplattform? Vi söker en Junior DevOps Engineer som trivs i gränslandet mellan utveckling och drift, och som brinner för automatisering, containerteknik och att skapa smidiga miljöer för utvecklingsteam.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN:** 




 I den här rollen ansvarar du för att utveckla, underhålla och förbättra infrastruktur och CI/CD-miljöer. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa stabila, säkra och effektiva leveranser, från kod till produktion. Du kommer vara en nyckelperson i att driva arbetet med Kubernetes, observability och automation framåt.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** 



* Hantera och optimera Kubernetes-kluster.
* Felsöka pods, loggar, resursbegränsningar.
* Bygga, underhålla och distribuera Docker-images.
* Vidareutveckla och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines i GitHub Actions eller Jenkins.
* Stötta utvecklingsteamen med developer enablement, installera och konfigurera verktyg, skapa reproducerbara lokala miljöer
* Automatisera repetitiva processer med Bash, Makefiles och Jenkinsfiles.



  





**Vi SÖKER DIG SOM HAR:** 



* Civilingenjörsutbildning inom relevant område, exempelvis datateknik eller informationsteknik
* Förståelse för Kubernetes och containerbaserade miljöer.
* Erfarenhet och intresse av att bygga och underhålla CI/CD-flöden.
* God förståelse för nätverk, säkerhet och molnbaserad infrastruktur.



  





 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet arbete av en liknande roll.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du efter 6-12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 



* Omfattning: Heltid
* Placering: Norra Stockholm
* Start: Omgående
* Lön: Marknadsmässig



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




  





*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




  





*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




  





*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: CloudOps Engineer
description:
Vår kund befinner sig i en pågående moderniseringsfas med fokus på att vidareutveckla och optimera sin molnbaserade infrastruktur. För att driva denna utveckling framåt söker vi på uppdrag av kunden en erfaren CloudOps Engineer som vill vara med och säkerställa stabil drift, utveckla infrastrukturlösningar samt bidra till ökad automatisering och effektivitet.
   

  

 I den här rollen blir du en central del av kundens IT-organisation och arbetar brett med servrar, nätverk, lagring, säkerhet och molntjänster. Rollen kommer att passa dig som vill kombinera tekniskt djup med ansvar och påverkan.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Förvalta och vidareutveckla kundens hybrid- och molninfrastruktur (Azure & AWS)
* Automatisera processer och drift genom PowerShell och CI/CD
* Hantera incident-, problem och förändringshantering enligt ITIL
* Säkerställa driftsäkerhet, backupstrategier och patch compliance
* Samarbeta tätt med utveckling, service delivery, NOC/SOC och externa leverantörer
* Övervaka och optimera systemprestanda
* Arbeta med IAM, EMM, nätverk och säkerhetsfrågor
* Administrera O365-miljöer (Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive)
* Delta i revisioner, leverantörsuppföljningar och SLA-rapportering
* Stötta och mentorera mer juniora kollegor vid behov


**Kravprofil:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av IT Operations eller liknande roll
* God erfarenhet av hybridmoln (Azure & AWS)
* Erfarenhet av Active Directory & Entra-ID
* Kunskap inom IAM, EMM, SSO och säkerhetslösningar
* God förståelse för nätverk (TCP/IP, DNS, VPN, VLAN, NSG)
* Erfarenhet av PowerShell-skript och automatisering
* Erfarenhet av virtualisering (Hyper-V och/eller VMware)
* Förståelse för ITSM-processer och verktyg
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska samt svenska, både tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Microsoft-certifieringar (Azure, O365 eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, Bicep/Terraform och DevOps-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av ServiceNow och/eller Azure DevOps
* Kunskap om GCP
* ITIL-certifiering


**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to Visa Open Banking - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa.
   

  





 Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analysed. Visa Open Banking handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what VOB engineers are doing.
   

  





 We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Infrastructure team. You will be part of the team responsible for maintaning and improving VOB system reliability, scalability and efficiency. Your primary focus will be on automating our operational activities and creating a bridge between operations and development.
   

  





 What we offer you:
   

  





 A position in the infrastructure team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:
   

  




* Providing VOB engineers with tailored self-service tools and services that enable teams to deliver, operate and observe their services, with low friction.


* Focusing on automation and tooling to enable other engineering teams to focus on core business activities.


* Automate provisioning, monitoring, and scaling using scripting (Python, Go, Bash).


* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


* Being a best practice champion, influence and create new designs, architectures, standards and methods for large-scale systems.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  




* Relevant work experience and a Bachelors degree, OR relevant work experience



 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  




* Work experience with a Bachelors Degree, an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or PhD.
* Proven experience in designing, building, and managing large-scale, dependable cloud services in close collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Go or Python.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud or Azure.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible.
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog.
* Experience with GenAI tools for coding and day to day tasks.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work as a part of the team.
* Ability to participate in an on-call rotation.


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Software Engineer Devops
description:
Are you interested in working across multiple domains – from designing and maintaining secure and efficient Windows Server/SQL Server/CICD environments to developing data-driven applications in Python, SQL, and SSIS — ensuring our systems and applications are secure, high-performing and reliable?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Design, implement, and maintain secure Windows Server, SQL Server and IIS environments, ensuring high availability, disaster recovery readiness, optimized performance and a robust permissions structure.
* Develop and maintain business applications and CICD infrastructure using Python, SQL, SSIS and GitHub actions.
* Embrace the DevOps mindset, “you build it, you run it”, being part of design, development, testing, planned maintenance activities, daily on-call and troubleshooting ensuring a good delivery quality.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure applications are delivered on time and follow the bank's security and regulatory guidelines.
* Monitor and optimize performance of infrastructure and applications, proactively assess and improve system and application security and performance staying ahead of emerging issues.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Solid experience in software development with Python and SQL, as well as familiarity with ETL design using SSIS.
* Relevant academic degree in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Proficient in DevOps, CICD pipelines, Git, and automation tools like GitHub Actions or Jenkins and building RestAPIs.
* Strong expertise in Windows Server administration and SQL Server database management, including performance tuning, backup/restore strategies and setting up SQL/Windows permissions.
* Familiarity with SAFE and Agile principles.
* Strong team player with excellent problem-solving and communication skills, a proactive and curious mindset, and a passion for learning new technologies.
* Knowledge of financial instruments and valuation theory is a bonus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 work with talented and motivated colleagues with an open and positive mindset. We will offer you an intellectually challenging job opportunity in a dynamic environment with good opportunities for personal development and growth. You will be a key player in the team who takes initiative and is happy to participate and influence our future development.”
 **Jerry Anderson** 
 ,
 **your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 17.11.2025.
   

  

 We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg & Malmskillnadsgatan**
**Recruiting manager: Jerry Anderson**
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Experienced IAM Engineer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
The IAM Platform team is now looking for a new team member. We work closely together and share the passion for great technology and creating a smooth engineering experience. Our group consists of people with different expertise, experiences, age and background. We have an open and friendly approach towards each other.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At this position within Hosting & Integration, you will be a part of a highly skilled team working with modern technology, security and developing of the IAM platforms, which are integrated in SEB DevOps toolchains. As a senior IAM Engineer you will create and evolve our IAM platform by investigating, developing, and implementing different technical solutions. This area is highly prioritized which creates many collaborations with various parts of the SEB organization. You will also be involved in SEB cloud journey.
   

  

 Your tasks will include designing, implementing and managing IAM solutions, deploying and managing the IAM Infrastructure, troubleshooting and resolving issues, ensuring compliance with security policies and best practices. In this role you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve the overall security posture of the organization.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* 5 years or more experience within IAM engineering. Expert and hands on experience on access management tools
* Good knowledge of networking fundamentals (TLS, DNS, proxies, firewalls, VPNs).
* Advanced knowledge of certificate management and PKI, including handling SSL/TLS certificates
* Advanced knowledge with identity federation technology (ex. OpenID Connect, OAuth2).
* Advanced knowledge with Single Sign-On and Multi Factor Authentication solution (ex. FIDO2).
* Advanced knowledge with DevSecOps tools (e.g. managing platforms with Kubernetes, Git, Github actions).
* Advanced knowledge in programming languages, such as Python, Java, go or Javascript.
* Good knowledge in Linux, Idap, Openshift and Infra-as-code (Terraform, Ansible and Helm)
* Advanced knowledge of cloud platforms.
* Experience operating within complex and highly integrated IT environments.
* Advanced troubleshooting capabilities and a deep understanding of IT infrastructure with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex identity and access issues across diverse systems and environments.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 25th of November 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Anton Hänni via email at anton.hanni@seb.se
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers**
 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Devops Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens DevOps-miljö hos ett bolag där teknik möter passion för djur? Vi söker dig som är en erfaren DevOps Engineer med djup kunskap inom Azure och ett brinnande intresse för att optimera utvecklings- och driftsprocesser.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som DevOps Engineer på Agria får du en nyckelroll i att stärka vår tekniska leverans genom att designa och vidareutveckla våra CI/CD-pipelines samt säkerställa robust och säker molninfrastruktur. Vi söker dig som både vill vara hands-on i tekniken och bidra strategiskt till våra DevOps-processer. Du är strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en föränderlig organisation där du får stort utrymme att påverka.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines
* Säkerställa implementering av DevSecOps-principer
* Automatisera driftsättningar och hantera infrastruktur i Azure Cloud
* Övervaka och optimera prestanda och säkerhet för våra molnbaserade lösningar
* Samarbeta nära utvecklingsteamen för att förbättra DevOps-flöden
* Felsöka tekniska problem kopplat till molninfrastruktur


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Djup kunskap om Azure Cloud-tjänster och verktyg
* Gedigen erfarenhet av DevSecOps
* Erfarenhet av Terraform, Ansible eller liknande verktyg för infrastruktur som kod
* Starkt grepp om CI/CD-principer, gärna via Azure DevOps, Jenkins eller GitLab CI
* Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes
* Goda kunskaper i skriptning/programmering, t.ex. Python, Bash eller PowerShell
* Vana att jobba i agila och dynamiska teammiljöer
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 Det är även meriterande om du har
   

  

* En certifiering inom Azure (t.ex. Azure DevOps Engineer Expert)
* Erfarenhet av andra molnplattformar som AWS eller Google Cloud
* Kunskap om säkerhetsverktyg och best practices för molnmiljöer
* Erfarnhet av att arbeta som Scrum Master


 Som person är du en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad person som trivs i förändring och gillar att samarbeta. Med din nyfikenhet, ditt driv och din prestigelöshet bidrar du till både teknisk utveckling och ett gott teamklimat.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss på Agria blir du en del av gruppen Kompetenscenter. Vårt mål är att tillsammans skapa en arbetsmiljö där alla trivs, har roligt, växer och mår bra. Vi strävar efter att erbjuda en plats som främjar kontinuerligt lärarande. Kompetenscenter har både ett strategiskt och operativt ansvar för att säkerställa bemanning och kompetens i vår virtuella leveransorganisation (SAFe). Här hittar du våra skickliga utvecklare inom olika tekniker, produktägare, affärsanalytiker, kravledare, QA-testare och Scrum Masters. Vi uppskattar att arbeta tillsammans på vårt nyrenoverade kontor på Gärdet i Stockholm. Här erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetsmiljö som hjälper dig att balansera arbete och vardag på bästa sätt.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha tillgång till unika förmåner som vi är säkra på att du kommer att uppskatta. Kanske vill du delta i aktiviteter med vår kamrat-, konst- eller idrottsförening? Eller varför inte träna i vårt fullt utrustade gym med roliga gruppträningspass? Du kan också njuta av god och näringsrik mat i vår alldeles egna personalrestaurang till subventionerat pris. Dessutom har vi ett hundkontor! Oavsett vad du föredrar, är vi övertygade om att du kommer hitta något som passar just dig och dina intressen. Som en del av Länsförsäkringsgruppen kan du även ta del av förmånliga bankerbjudanden, rabatter på djur och -sakförsäkringar och personlig pensionsrådgivning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team och tillsammans skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-12**

title: Test Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Understanding of JavaScript
* Previous knowledge of Web Analytics is helpful
* Test Management and documentation
* Automation expertise (Selenium Or Robot)
* Knowledge of Testing Tools BrowserStack, JIRA, QMetry, Confluence,
* Critical Thinking and Analytical Skills
* Take ownership of the QA processes and able to collaborate with stakeholders
* Knowledge of Agile/Scrum


**Application deadline:** 
 16-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**📊 Data & Analytics Engineer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





*Shape the future of data-driven decision-making in a modernising enterprise* 




  





 A well-established Swedish company is undergoing a major digital transformation and is looking for a
 **Data & Analytics Engineer** 
 to help build and optimise its new cloud-based data platform. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-impact team at the early stages of a long-term data modernisation journey.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full data lifecycle - from ingestion and modelling to orchestration and reporting - using modern tools like DBT, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. The role blends elements of analytics engineering, BI development, and data pipeline optimisation, offering broad exposure and real ownership.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Own and evolve the company’s DBT-based data models, supporting business-critical reporting and analytics
* Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with business users to understand data needs and translate them into scalable models
* Orchestrate and monitor data pipelines using Azure Data Factory
* Optimise Snowflake usage and cost, and contribute to performance tuning
* Support legacy SQL Server-based data flows and help plan their gradual migration to the cloud
* Work closely with a small team to shape the company’s modern BI architecture



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Core** 
 : SQL, DBT, Power BI, Snowflake
* **Cloud & Orchestration** 
 : Azure, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage
* **Other** 
 : Python (for light scripting), Git, Medallion architecture (Bronze/Silver/Gold)



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong SQL skills and experience with data modelling and transformation
* Familiarity with DBT or a strong interest in learning it
* Experience building reports in Power BI or similar tools
* Understanding of data orchestration and pipeline monitoring (e.g., ADF, Airflow)
* Ability to work across both backend and frontend data layers
* Interest in staying up to date with new features and best practices in the data ecosystem
* Swedish language proficiency is required due to stakeholder interaction and on-call responsibilities



  





 💼 Role Details
 


* **Location** 
 : Sollentuna, Stockholm (50/50 hybrid)
* **Benefits** 
 : Competitive salary, Union agreement, pension, wellness allowance, and more
* **Team** 
 : You’ll work alongside a small but growing data team, with lots of room to shape processes and tooling



  





 🚀 Why This Role?
 


* Join a company at the start of a major cloud and data transformation
* Work with modern tools and architectures in a greenfield environment
* Take ownership of key systems and influence long-term strategy
* Be part of a stable, profitable business with a strong customer base and ambitious tech leadership

title: Senior IT Test Automation Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Senior IT Test Automation Engineer** 
 to join our team and contribute to the delivery of reliable, high-quality IT systems. This role involves working across multiple testing disciplines and technologies, with a particular focus on microservices-based architectures. The ideal candidate is a proactive problem solver who excels in designing, implementing, and maintaining robust automated testing solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Analyze business and technical requirements to design comprehensive test strategies, plans, and test cases.
* Identify and define test scenarios across functional, integration, and technical layers.
* Develop and maintain scalable, automated test frameworks and solutions from the ground up.
* Prepare, manage, and optimize test data and test environments.
* Perform testing of microservices and RESTful APIs, ensuring proper isolation and handling of dependencies.
* Collaborate effectively within Agile, Scrum, or SAFe teams, supporting CI/CD and DevOps initiatives.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of testing practices, tools, and methodologies.


**Requirements:**
* Programming: Strong proficiency in Java 21, with a solid understanding of object-oriented programming and design patterns.
* Testing Expertise:
+ Test Data Management
+ Test Environment Management
+ Test Management
+ Automated Functional Testing
+ Functional Testing
+ Performance Testing
+ Technical and Web Services Testing

* Tools & Technologies:
+ RESTful API testing (HTTP methods, status codes, headers)
+ SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
+ Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices

* Architecture: Deep understanding of microservices principles, design, and implementation.
* Languages: Fluent in English (spoken and written).
* ISTQB Agile Tester certification (or willingness to obtain)
* ISTQB Foundation Level certification (or willingness to obtain)
* ISTQB Test Automation Engineer certification (or willingness to obtain)


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Data Engineer (GCP)
description:
We are seeking an experienced
 **Data Engineer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 and modern data engineering tools. The ideal candidate will be responsible for building, optimizing, and supporting data products in line with our strategic vision — ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance across all data solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Take
 **end-to-end ownership** 
 of designing, building, optimizing, and supporting new and existing
 **data products** 
 .
* Manage and enhance
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 ,
 **Terraform-based infrastructure** 
 , and overall
 **GCP cloud operations** 
 .
* Ensure
 **data products** 
 meet high standards of
 **security, scalability, observability, and performance** 
 .
* Collaborate closely with
 **Product Owners** 
 and
 **stakeholders** 
 to shape the vision and roadmap for data products.
* Contribute to the organization’s
 **data mesh strategy** 
 , integrating solutions across domains.
* Continuously evaluate and improve existing systems to
 **reduce technical debt** 
 and enhance data capabilities.
* Stay current with
 **emerging technologies** 
 in data engineering, cloud computing, and analytics.



  





**Technical Skills (Must Have)** 



* **GCP Services:**

title: Software Engineer
description:
Ready to combine deep engineering expertise and a product-first mindset to redefine the future of digital banking? As a Software Engineer at Nordiska, you’ll help shape system architecture, deliver complex features, and write high-quality coding - building embedded finance where banking meets tech.
   

  

**About Nordiska**
 Nordiska is a bank that provides innovative financial products for both companies and consumers. Nordiska Embedded is a platform for embedded financial services, where we offer savings, lending, and payment services, either under our own brand or through partners. Nordiska also provides corporate and real estate financing, as well as sustainable savings with a government-backed deposit guarantee.
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

 Our code of conduct is the foundation for everything we do. We act with honesty and responsibility to build long-term trust among customers, partners, and employees. We believe that diversity drives innovation and encourages each employee to contribute their unique expertise and perspective. We are driven and dedicated to making a difference. Our employees receive a competitive benefits package.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer, you will primarily work with Nordiska Embedded. We combine the best of two worlds - at our core, we’re a stable, regulated bank paired with a product-tech mentality that thrives on agility, curiosity, and innovation. As Nordiska expands into new markets, onboards new customers, builds new products and features - you work closely with the Tech Lead and Lead Engineer to set technical standards and ensure that the team’s output is robust, scalable, and secure. You’ll be an important part of modernizing systems, reducing technical debt, and are a key contributor to system architecture, complex feature development, and code quality.
   

  

 In addition to your technical work, you'll be mentoring mid-level and junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and being a part of a high-performing team, as we grow.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Drive engineering excellence by defining technical standards, system architecture, design principles, and long-term technology strategy for engineering excellence.
* Deliver high-impact features - implementing complex functionality that meets stringent performance, reliability, and security requirements.
* Drive initiatives that improve performance, enhance scalability, and reduce technical debt.
* Anticipate and resolve architectural bottlenecks, proactively preventing issues.
* Ensure best practices, clean code, testing/observability, and a culture of continuous learning.
* Ensure technical excellence through structured code reviews, consistent application of coding standards, and alignment with established best practices.
* Collaborate cross-functionally and work closely with Product and Engineering leadership to ensure technical execution supports strategic objectives.


 We’re Looking for Someone who has
   

  

* Mid- or senior-level depth in programming, frameworks, and system design in C#/.NET.
* Expertise in event-driven architecture (EDA) and Azure, with a strong interest in AI technologies considered an advantage.
* Hands-on expertise with architectural patterns, scaling strategies, performance optimization, security, scalability and resilience.
* Demonstrated capability to mentor others and lead by example.
* Proven track record of delivering high-quality, large-scale software systems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 Your Professional Profile
   

  

* As a true self-leader, you take ownership and operate effectively in a fast-paced, high-accountability environment.
* You communicate clearly, collaborate seamlessly across functions, and navigate confidently in a regulated context.
* You’ll contribute to a high-performing and humble team, bringing strong analytical skills and a proactive, solution-driven approach.


 Application & Process
   

  

 If you’re looking to join a growth-driven environment that pairs innovation with profitability and reliability, welcome to Nordiska. We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 We review and interview continuously, with background checks as part of the final stage of our process. For questions about the role, or for more information, you are warmly welcome to contact Ida Garamvölgyi at ida.garamvolgyi@nordiska.com or +46704-385 325.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Advanced proficiency in Java and/or Kotlin, with strong expertise in JVM ecosystem, concurrent programming, and modern backend development patterns
* Extensive hands-on experience with AWS cloud services (EC2, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS), building scalable and maintainable cloud-native applications
* Proven experience in developing high-performance distributed systems, focusing on performance optimization, security, and fault tolerance
* Strong ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, contributing to technical leadership through code reviews, architecture discussions, and mentoring junior engineers
* Deep knowledge of backend technologies including RESTful APIs, GraphQL, message queues, and modern build tools (Gradle, Maven)
* Expert understanding of database design, caching strategies, and backend testing frameworks, ensuring robust and maintainable code


**Meritorious**
* Experience with large-scale, high-throughput distributed systems
* Knowledge of security best practices and payment processing systems
* Contributions to open-source backend projects
* Microservices architecture, event-driven systems, and modern deployment strategies (CI/CD, containerization with Docker/Kubernetes)


**Application deadline:** 
 14-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: System Engineer
description:
Vill du göra skillnad genom att vara med och bygga framtidens tekniska plattformar för ett av Sveriges största försäkringsbolag? Vi söker nu en System Engineer till vårt Infrastrukturteam – ett team med ett avgörande uppdrag: att tillhandahålla och vidareutveckla infrastrukturen för våra sakförsäkringssystem.
 



  





 Hos oss får du arbeta med modern teknik, påverka tekniska vägval och vara en nyckelspelare i vår digitala transformation.
 



  





**Det här gör du som System Engineer på Folksam** 




 Som System Engineer hos oss kommer du att:
 


* Utveckla och förvalta vår infrastruktur, CI/CD-pipelines, monitorering och automatisering.
* Arbeta hands-on med deployer, testmiljöhantering och incidenthantering.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam, arkitekter och andra teknikspecialister för att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.
* Säkerställa att våra plattformar lever upp till krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet, kostnadseffektivitet och kontinuitet.
* Bidra till arkitekturella underlag och tekniska beslut som påverkar hela bolaget.



  





 Vi arbetar bland annat med:
 


* Azure
* Red Hat OpenShift
* GitLab
* Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD
* HashiCorp Vault, JFrog Artifactory och Xray
* Elastic (ELK-Stack) för monitorering och logghantering
* MS SQL, SQL management studio, Powershell



 Du får stor frihet att påverka både din egen tekniska utveckling och Folksams tekniska riktning.
 



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Nu söker vi dig som:
 


* Har flerårig erfarenhet av teknik- och plattformsarbete.
* Ser helheten i tekniska leveranser och fångar upp frågor som annars riskerar att falla mellan stolarna.
* Har relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Ser ständigt lärande som en självklarhet.
* Är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och gillar att samarbeta med andra.



  





 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av:
 


* Moderna plattformar som Kubernetes och Openshift.
* Versionshanterad infrastrukturkod och automatisering.
* Att designa och utveckla robusta och säkra lösningar enligt regulatoriska krav.
* Felsökning inom CI/CD, DevSecOps och monitoreringsplattformar.
* Skriptning
* Agila arbetssätt och verktyg, gärna SAFe.



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 24 november 2025.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Mattias Sahlström, 070-831 63 26.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Ylva Landerfors Nordqvist 072-468 72 30 och Handels Mikael Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



  





*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**Senior Fullstack Developer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





 We’re partnering with a Stockholm-based independent consultancy that’s redefining what consulting can look like — smaller, more personal, and focused on long-term partnerships rather than short-term assignments.
 



  





 You’ll join a close-knit, senior development team that works end-to-end on meaningful projects for well-known Swedish brands across industries like finance, retail, and tech. Here, you won’t be one of many - you’ll have a real voice in technical direction, influence architectural decisions, and help shape the systems you build from concept through to production.
 



  





 This consultancy takes a people-first approach: stability, work-life balance, and genuine collaboration are at the heart of how they operate. The team values curiosity, clear communication, and developers who enjoy taking ownership and working closely with both clients and colleagues.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* 6+ years of professional experience in .NET development
* Experience building and maintaining cloud-based systems in Azure
* Solid understanding of frontend frameworks, ideally React
* Strong background in database design and management (SQL & NoSQL)
* Good understanding of CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices
* Strong communication skills and ability to engage confidently in client discussions
* A genuine team player who values collaboration, ownership, and long-term impact

**What’s on offer**
