title: Senior Data Engineer – Stockholm
description:
Är du en erfaren Dataingenjör, BI-utvecklare/BI-konsult eller ETL-utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär? Drömmer du om att arbeta med modern teknik och lösa komplexa problem tillsammans med ett nätverk av skickliga Data- och Analysexperter? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
   

  

 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

**Möt en av våra Data Engineers:** 
 Clara Lundström arbetar i ett projekt för ett globalt företag inom facility service, det största i Norden. Tillsammans med sitt team illustrerar hon datalandskapet och använder data från olika källor för att skapa visualiseringar. Clara beskriver arbetet på Solita som varierat och utvecklande, med tillgång till ett stort nätverk av experter inom många olika områden.
   

  

**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En företagskultur som präglas av autonomi, stöd och gemensam tillväxt.
* Spännande kundprojekt och erfarna kollegor som är omtänksamma och passionerade.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med en stor bredd av projekt och branscher.
* Partnerskap med ledande tech-företag som GCP, AWS och Snowflake.


**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
 Som Data Engineer på Solita jobbar du brett; end-to-end från ingestion hela vägen till visualisering. Det är bra om du har erfarenhet inom; pipelines, ingestion, datawarehousing modellering, analys och visualisering. Exempel på tekniker vi arbetar med är Snowflake, Matillion, DBT, Databricks, Fabric, Data factory, Bigquery och mer! Vi jobbar även ofta i cloud och arbetar primärt i Python eller SQL. Som konsult på Solita är det viktigt att du kan kommunicera tekniska lösningar till kunder och hantera deras behov och problem. Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden i Rollen**
* Självständigt leverera komplexa uppdrag inom ditt expertområde och planera de bästa åtgärderna för att nå önskade resultat.
* Utveckla arbetsmetoder och processer samt vägleda och agera mentor till andra.
* Analysera nya problem, bedöma teknisk information och andra källor, samt utveckla nya lösningar.
* Optimera befintliga processer och delta i utvecklingen av nya processer av avdelningsövergripande betydelse.
* Leverera lösningar till kunder och samarbeta nära med dem för att förstå och möta deras behov.


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**En dag på Solita:** 
 Din dag kan börja med ett standup-möte med kund och team-medlemmar, följt av kodnära arbete som att bygga data pipelines och programmera i Python/SQL. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund eller kollegor, eller interna utbildningsmöten. Dagen avslutas ofta med mer kodarbete, möten och inte minst – fika!
   

  

**Våra förmåner**
 Hos Oss Får Du Inte Bara Trevliga Kollegor Utan Du Får Även Ta Del Av Ett Brett Förmånspaket. Här Är Några Utav Våra Förmåner
   

  

 💰 Fast lön, oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 ⚖️ Interna mentorskapsprogram
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vid frågor; kontakta jacob.beck(at)solita.se eller ansök här. Du kan också connecta med Jacob på LinkedIn på https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacob-beck-/. Vi uppskattar dina färdigheter, men vi är också ivriga att lära oss om essensen i din motivation och hur du ser din tillväxt framför dig. Dela ditt CV nedan så återkommer vi så fort vi kan!
   

  

**Under sommaren kan vår återkoppling dröja något längre än vanligt. Vi hörs av oss senast i augusti. Tack för din förståelse och ha en fin sommar!**
 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita
   

  

 Subscribe

title: Senior Backend Software Developer (Full-time)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
 Our Head of GO Cards Cédric and his team are looking for a Senior Backend Software Developer to join our Stockholm office. This role is ideal for someone experienced who wants to deliver real impact today while preparing to take on more responsibility in the future.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Impactful work: Your code directly powers secure identity services used by real customers worldwide.
* A pragmatic environment: We value smart choices over shiny tools. You'll use the most adapted technologies to solve problems, reduce complexity, and limit future technical debt.
* A healthy team culture: We believe in humility, collaboration, and keeping team well-being in balance with delivery goals.
* End-to-end responsibility: You'll see the whole lifecycle, from development through deployment to customer use.
* Growth into leadership: Over time, you'll have the opportunity to take on a bigger role in driving initiatives and supporting others in the team.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 You will join Nexus GO Cards team, our online service that lets customers order secure and customized identity cards (smart cards), key fobs, and accessories. Customers can order via our card management portal or integrate directly through our APIs.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Focus on backend development, with responsibility for services, databases, and system integrations.
* Develop, improve, and maintain services with a strong focus on reliability, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
* Select and use technologies based on problem-solving value, not trendiness.
* Ensure that deliveries are on time and secure, always balancing speed with quality.
* Collaborate closely with teammates and stakeholders, enabling fast and sustainable delivery.
* Over time, take a leading role in driving improvements in both technology and ways of working.


**Some Of Our Tech Stack**
* Java (primary language: deep expertise required)
* Spring Boot
* REST, Microservices, Databases
* Azure (cloud environment), Docker, Kubernetes


**About You**
* Highly experienced in backend Java development and proficient with Azure.
* Results-oriented: you deliver what is needed, when it is needed.
* Pragmatic: you enjoy new technology but choose what best solves the current problem while limiting technical debt.
* Humble and grounded: you listen, collaborate, and keep the team's health in mind.
* Independent yet collaborative: you take initiative but thrive in teamwork.
* User-focused: the end user's experience is always your guiding star.


**Qualifications**
* Extensive experience in Java backend development is required.
* 2+ years of experience with Azure DevOps is a must.
* Professional proficiency in English.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with Spring Boot and modern development practices is a plus.
* Solid understanding of Microservices and integrations is an advantage.
* Experience with cloud environments (Azure, Docker, Kubernetes).
* Cybersecurity knowledge.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Background check**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: Android Engineer (+ Backend Expertise)
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
* Primary Focus (Android): The ideal candidate will be highly proficient in Kotlin and modern Android development practices, with 5-6 years of professional experience.
* Secondary Focus (Backend): The role requires the ability to perform basic backend engineering tasks using Java.
* Experience: Must have experience building and deploying consumer-facing products, ideally within a large-scale organization.


**Application deadline: 14-11-2025**
**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Vill du vara med och ta LRF:s medlemskommunikation inom rekrytering och lojalitet till nästa nivå? Vi söker nu en Marketing Automation specialist som med teknik, kreativitet och datadrivna insikter vill skapa engagerande och relevanta upplevelser för våra medlemmar.
 



  





 Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka, utvecklas och bidra till samhällsnytta – samtidigt som du jobbar i ett team präglat av nyfikenhet, tillit och framåtanda.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Marketing Automation specialist blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av vårt arbete med CRM, lojalitet och marketing automation. Du ansvarar för att skapa relevanta, personliga och skalbara medlemsdialoger – från onboarding till lojalitet och lead nurturing.
 



 Du kombinerar strategisk höjd med operativt genomförande och arbetar datadrivet för att optimera våra kundresor och automatiserade kommunikationsflöden. I rollen ansvarar du för att utveckla och förbättra våra triggerbaserade CRM flöden, testa och analysera resultat, och skapa nya processer för lead nurturing kopplat till medlemsrekrytering – ett område med stor utvecklingspotential.
 



  





**Du kommer att** 



* Driva och vidareutveckla våra automatiserade och triggerbaserade CRM flöden, främst inom e-post.
* Skapa, testa och optimera kundresor och beteendetriggade kommunikationsflöden.
* Bygga upp och utveckla processer för lead nurturing.
* Analysera resultat och beteendedata för att driva kontinuerlig förbättring av våra flöden och kommunikation.
* Segmentera målgrupper och identifiera utvecklingsmöjligheter.
* Samarbeta med kommunikationsteamet kring innehåll och utskick.
* Bidra till teamets utvecklingsarbete och ibland leda mindre projekt kopplade till CRM och MA.



  





**Om dig** 




 Du är en analytisk och kreativ person som trivs med att kombinera strategi, data och teknik för att skapa engagerande kommunikation. Du är strukturerad, självgående och van att driva projekt från idé till resultat.
 



 Du blir en del av enheten Medlemsutveckling, ett team på sju personer med roller inom digital marknadsföring, telemarketing, kommunikation och kundresor, copywriting, analys och insikter. Du rapporterar till enhetschef.
 



 Tillsammans arbetar du nära övriga kollegor på avdelningen Försäljning & Medlemsdialog i ett agilt arbetssätt präglat av test, lärande och utveckling – alltid med medlemmens behov i fokus.
 


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller systemvetenskap.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av operativt CRM- och marketing automation arbete.
* Vana av verktyg som ActiveCampaign, HubSpot, Rule, Customer.io, Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller SendGrid.
* Erfarenhet av A/B-testning, analys och optimering.
* Erfarenhet av lead nurturing.



**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet från en medlems- eller kunddriven organisation.
* Erfarenhet av Power BI, SQL eller agila arbetssätt (Scrum).



  





  





**Om Lantbrukarnas Riksförbund (LRF)** 




 Lantbrukarnas Riksförbund (LRF) är en medlemsägd organisation som arbetar för att skapa bättre förutsättningar för Sveriges lantbrukare, skogsägare och landsbygdsföretagare. Vi är en drivkraft för det gröna näringslivet – med fokus på hållbarhet, innovation och medlemsnytta.
 



 Vår kultur präglas av samarbete, kunskapsdelning och nyfikenhet. Vi testar nytt, lär av varandra och bygger tillit genom gemensamma mål. Tillsammans skapar vi en stark och hållbar framtid för Sveriges landsbygd.
 



  





**Om rekryteringsprocessen** 




 Det här är en rekrytering via Digitalenta. Processen består av intervju, psykometriska tester och arbetsprov.

title: Technical Sales Support - Hydrodynamics
description:
Are you a driven engineer looking for an exciting role that combines technical sales support and propeller blade design? Due to an internal move, our Kongsberg Maritime’s (KM) experienced Technical Sales Support team are looking for a new colleague. Whether you're an experienced engineer or a recent graduate, if you are technically savvy, curious and motivated to work within the field of Hydrodynamics with a world leader of maritime solutions, this may be the opportunity for you!

**Your Role**


As a Technical Sales Support Engineer, you'll be involved from the initial project calculations and proposal through to the final design, also providing support when issues arise for sailing vessels. While most of your work will be done from the office, you'll occasionally join our sales team on customer visits, participate in pre-studies or take part in sea trials.


The Technical Sales Support team of engineers work within KM’s Global Customer Support division. In this position, you will work with upgrades of existing customer products having a close and effective collaboration with both aftermarket sales function and the team of experts in our Hydrodynamic Research Centre based in Kristinehamn, to create the best upgrading proposals and propeller designs. You'll communicate these solutions to customers, showing how we can meet their needs with efficient product upgrades.


You'll create propeller blade designs using our in-house software, PropCalc. Through simulation and testing in our lab, you'll help deliver high-end products to our customers. You'll gain a deep understanding of how propulsion systems work in different vessels and applications, contributing to product development, research, and business intelligence.

**What We Offer**


We offer an inspiring and safe work environment and the possibility to work with sustainable and exciting solutions for the future. A position with a wide range of challenging work tasks, opportunities to make a real difference and develop on a technical and personal level. You will have the opportunity to work with unique products at a world leading supplier of maritime solutions. You will work in an international environment and in multidisciplinary team collaboration where some travelling can be part of your work depending on projects and interest. We offer flexible working hours and the option to work partly remote based on your work tasks.


You will have the chance to collaborate closely with and learn from some of the best experts in the industry within hydrodynamics through a tight partnership with our world-class Kongsberg Hydrodynamic Research Center in Kristinehamn. This provides a unique opportunity to develop your skills and deepen your expertise in hydrodynamics.

**Qualifications and Experience**


You have at least a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Naval Architecture or equivalent. Knowledge in fluid mechanics, numerical simulation (CFD) and CAD is seen as positive, but not a requirement. If you have recently graduated and don’t have experience already, with the right attitude, we're here to help you grow. We are all about hands-on challenges and support to help you become the best engineer you can be. We are open to providing any relevant training and support to help you increase your competence level especially in the area of Hydrodynamics.


Due to the nature of an international customer and supplier base, a high level of English, both written and spoken, is valuable. Communication skills in other languages are advantageous.


We appreciate your ability to act on own initiative and analyse complex issues and problems to come up with rational judgments. Collaboration is key, so we appreciate your ability to work well with others, communicate clearly, share knowledge, and support your colleagues in achieving team goals.

*Kongsberg works with customers from both the commercial and naval market segments.*

*As our Engineers work with classified materials, security clearance and export control may be required for this position and questions related to citizenship will be part of the selection process.*


Our ambition is to fill the position as soon as possible; selection and interviews may therefore begin during the application period.

**Location**: Kristinehamn

**Last day to apply 2025-****11-30**

**Interested in knowing more?**

**Point of contact**


Thomas Gunnarsson, Manager Technical Sales Support


+46(0)72 182 94 57, thomas.gunnarsson@km.kongsberg.com


Georgina Fielding, HR Specialist


+46(0)76 894 55 92, georgina.fielding@km.kongsberg.com

**Kongsberg Maritime** is a technology pioneer, enabling a more sustainable future for our oceans. Our zero-emission integrated technologies advance the maritime industry and solve our customers' toughest problems. With unmatched competence, domain knowledge, innovation, and market reach, we are the trusted maritime partner. Headquartered in Kongsberg, Norway, the company has manufacturing, sales and service facilities in 35 countries.

**Kongsberg Maritime in Kristinehamn** consists of 360 engaged people working with sales, research, development, construction, service and assembly of market leading solutions.


Our **Global Customer Support** division is responsible for Kongsberg Maritimes services, upgrades and support in the aftermarket. Our 3000 employees are present in 35 different countries around the world. During the operational lifetime of more than 30.000 installations, we ensure cost-efficient delivery of services, upgrades and spare parts in order to secure availability and predictability to our customers.

**Protechting People & Planet**

title: Senior Financial Quantitative Engineer
description:
**About the Role:**  

**The Role:** Senior Financial Quantitative Engineer triCalculate
  
  

**The Team:** triCalculate, part of OSTTRA, offers web-based centralized services for high performance XVA risk calculations, independent trade valuations, margin, and capital requirement calculations for OTC derivatives. The quant team is responsible for all models, risk calculations and model implementation and documentation covered by triCalculate.We encourage a culture of always taking time to help others, both within the team but also people from other teams. We grow when we grow together!
  
  

**The Impact:** triCalculate's provides a wide range of calculations to help financial institutions. As a quant, you will be very important in developing the core calculation components, which directly affects all our client base. The XVA space provides excellent challenges within the financial mathematics field.
  
  

**What’s in it for you:**  

You will work in a small quant team with experts in both financial mathematics and software engineering
  
  

triCalculate is becoming a central risk analytics service and you will join in a time when we are expanding into new areas
  
  

You will join a very driven work environment and we rely on the responsibility and expertise on the individuals to continuously evolve our service, and our ways of working. This means that you will be able to influence which tools we're using, how we develop software and how we work as a team, but it also means that we have high expectations on all employees to take responsibility, speak up when something isn't working and to have a genuine interest in your craft and wanting to learn new skills
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Implement new and improve existing financial models for derivative pricing in order to expand product coverage
  
  

Interact with clients regarding model validation questions, as part of the sales process to answer enquiries, and internal support questions
  
  

Maintain and develop the existing C++ and Golang backend for SIMM, XVA, central valuation and market data validation
  
  

Work closely with the product and business managers to improve the valuation and risk service offering provided by OSTTRA
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

At least 5 years of experience working as a quant at a bank, or developing pricing and risk software
  
  

Deep knowledge in both financial mathematics as well as software engineering
  
  

Fluent in English
  
  

Be comfortable working closely with your colleagues and respect everyone's opinions regardless of seniority or background
  
  

Embrace diversity and be respectful to all colleagues and clients
  
  

About OSTTRA
  
  

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.
  
  

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
  
With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
  
Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
  
  

Learn more at www.osttra.com .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert:**  

If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com . S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here .
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
  
  

----------------------------------------------------------- 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)

title: Supplier Development Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Role description**
--------------------


Key responsibilities will include building strong relationship with our suppliers that creates benefits for both parties. You will be involved in evaluation and selection of suppliers, and the driver of APQP/PPAP activities for selected projects working close to our Technology organization. You will also be a part of creation and execution of Purchasing strategies, and with that comes encouraging our suppliers for development and increase innovation.


You will in your role also educate and mentor activities from cost to quality requirements. To steer sustainability supply chain management programs and drive productivity improvement program such as VPS/Lean and guide continuous improvement actions will also be in your responsibility.

 **This is us, your new colleagues**


Supplier Development Europe team is a diverse group of colleagues respecting Volvo group values (change, customer success, passion, trust, and performance) that creates a high performing culture. We are an effective and efficient one team organization with a lot of experience in Quality management and Lean manufacturing. We are building tailored Supplier development programs with our suppliers to boost Quality, Sustainability, Capacity, Cost performance and aligning suppliers’ strategies with our purchasing goals and expectations.

**Who are you?**
----------------


We are looking for a colleague, who has an agile character, is eager to learn and improve. You have a positive and entrepreneurial mindset and always looking for the next target to reach. You are experienced in driving project management in an effective way and have knowledge about product development.


Your communicational capability makes it easy for you to make contact with both internal and external stakeholders, you have the ability to manage and influence others, as well as you are structured and focused on the execution. You are analytic and have a sustainable mindset. We think that you are comfortable in meeting and working cross-functional and able to work within remote management, and also to have plenty of topics on your plate at the same time.

 **KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE we are looking for**


University degree in electronics and/or software development/production/quality  

Experience in Electronics production processes and quality assurance  

Experience in Software development and quality assurance  

Knowledge in supply chain management and Lean manufacturing  

Good communication skills in English

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


For more information:  

Christian Magnusson, Head of Supplier Development CAB/Sheet Metal & Plastics/Paint/Electrics & Electronics/Software Europe: +46 16 541 45 10.

  

Location: flexible Eskilstuna, Braås, Arvika, Hallsberg, Konz, Wroclav, Belley


Last applicationday is 30th of November.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

Part of Volvo Group, **Volvo Construction Equipment** is a global company driven by our purpose to build the world we want to live in. Together we develop and deliver solutions for a cleaner, smarter, and more connected world. By unleashing everyone’s full potential, we build a more sustainable future for all our stakeholders. Come join our team and help us build a better tomorrow.

title: CAD/PLM Solution Engineer - XR Platform
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Position Description**
------------------------


You will be part of an engaged and kind team in an international and multicultural environment and within a department supporting our future IT solutions in the Virtual products lifecycle management area.

  

Are you interested in digitalization, the latest technology? Do you want to work with a bunch of incredibly driven, passionate, and skilled people? Great! Volvo Group is now searching for a CAD/PLM solution engineer within the virtual lifecycle management domain with a focus on immersive visualization and simulation solutions, such as 1:1 scale single and multi-user XR Engineering reviews.

  

Virtual Lifecycle Management solutions cover CAD, Virtual Product lifecycle management (PLM), Augmented, Mixed and Virtual reality (XR) applications. The solutions are a key enabler to achieve engineering efficiency, virtual trust, and the digital twin capabilities across the Volvo Group.

**THIS IS US, YOUR NEW COLLEAGUES**
-----------------------------------


We are PLM / 3D PLM global support solution Centre working to increase Product Development efficiency through a varied set of digital and IT solutions.

  

Our existing IT solutions comprises of a mix of varied technologies based on commercial off the shelf (COTS) IT solutions and SaaS solutions from CAD and PLM vendors, as well as in-house developed Volvo adaptations. We find ourselves on the cusp of a transformation with heavy investments to transform and modernize our overall IT architecture.

  

We are supporting the Volvo Group’s Digital ambitions to become a fully agile, data-driven company.

  

We have started a PLM modernization journey to shape Volvo’s future way of working within the PDM/PLM domain. We are facing a very challenging and exciting period as we are creating the future IT environment in this area.

 **Role Description Your Mission:**

 **We look for a CAD/PLM XR solution engineer in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) area**

  

As an XR platform solution engineer, you are involved in a wide range of activities and deliverables, including providing global, cross-functional support, conducting training sessions, gathering, analyzing and documenting user requirements for diverse use cases and developing methods and training material to assist Volvo Group engineers with their vehicle project deliveries. You will work hands-on with our users when they are using the XR engineering applications, establishing methods and workflows, evaluating and proposing hardware solutions and configurations, and suggesting best practices with other current tools.

  

You will also be the IT team’s main ear to the ground, collecting important business feedback through your deliveries and supporting the development of the area in the right direction from a user perspective. Since you are part of a global unit, you will have global interactions and responsibilities to actively cooperate with various stakeholders in a multi-cultural environment.

  

Additionally, your role will include live coaching and advisory support during Volvo Group engineers’ engineering review sessions, ensuring they can fully leverage XR technologies and workflows for optimal project outcomes.

**Role mission & context**
--------------------------


As a CAD/PLM XR solution engineer, you will be part of an experienced agile team of other solution engineers and software engineers sharing knowledge and insights in global automotive product projects. You will have Digital & IT colleagues in Bangalore, Lyon, Gothenburg, and Greensboro, and support users from all Volvo Group sites.

 **Wanted Profile**

  

As a CAD/PLM XR solution engineer, you will be part of a work environment that embraces culture and desired behaviors that values change and trust. You will be the part in creating a positive team spirit and a fun place to work that appeals to others to join the team. Competencies we are looking for are:

  

* Experience in Product Development, Virtual Manufacturing and/or Product Lifecycle Management
* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical/Manufacturing/Product Development Engineering with good understanding of mechanical systems
* Good hands-on skills in CAD/PLM and CAE/Ergo simulation knowledge: Creo Parametric, CATIA V5, Creo View, Autodesk or related tools
* Testing and troubleshooting (of complex systems)
* Ability to work in and navigate in agile teams
* Lean mindset and are driven to understand and improve the day-to-day experience for our XR tool users
* Effective verbal, written communication, training/coaching skills, empathy, and relationship building skills.
* Fluent in English
* A plus is experience with Volvo Group product development CAD and CAE and Ergonomic simulations.

  

We are not looking for developers for this role.

**We can offer you:**
---------------------


An attractive working environment where you will get an opportunity to work together with highly skilled colleagues in a global environment

  

* An opportunity to work with XR applications and hardware.
* To work with exciting techniques and development practices in a complex technical environment
* To grow your competence both within IT as well as the automotive domain
* You will work in close collaboration with our customers/users, suppliers, and development team.

  

Together we deliver cutting-edge solutions and services which drive profitability and growth. You will be part of an organization where continues improvements and fulfillment of business value is vital. We are expected to deliver a state-of-the-art solution for a stable and effective Product development environment, to develop the solutions to increase the efficiency for our stakeholders. We work closely together with the delivery teams within our Solution Center in a global environment.

  

The location will be Gothenburg. EU citizen or valid work permit.  

Travel occasionally

  

We are looking forward to your application!


Hiring manager: Anders Fors, Digital Product Area Owner

  

Last application date is: 1st December 2025

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: Operations Engineer Citrix
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**  

Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi på Vattenfall IT söker nu en Operations Engineer inom Virtual client & system software solutions (Citrix) som vill arbeta med utveckling och leverans av våra IT-tjänster, där säker och stabil drift är högsta prioritet. Vi erbjuder en spännande teknikroll och för dig som kandidat är det här en chans att ta plats i en organisation som genomgår en spännande förvandling med nya tekniska lösningar och utökade samarbetsytor.


Som Operations Engineer kommer du att vara en del av ett team men vi ser även att du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt mot externa leverantörer såväl som kollegor runt om i Sverige och Europa. För dig som individ finns det stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och påverkan i den dagliga leveransen.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Drift och övervakning av centralt managerade kundmiljöer
* Säkerställa att befintliga miljöer utvecklas och ansvara för design och implementation av lösningar
* Delta i transformations- och förändringsprojekt
* Effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Patchhantering och uppgradering
* Felsökning i varierad storlek och komplexitet

  

**Kvalifikationer**  

* Arbetat i stora miljöer både med drift och utveckling av IT-infrastruktur
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet av Citrix CVAD, Windows server, Windows 11
* Har kunskap om VDI, AD, GPO, Nätverk
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat i både tal och skrift
* Förstår och anammar högt IT säkerhetstänk
* Innehar körkort B

**Det är meriterande om du har:**

* Kunskaper om IT-relaterade processer och ramverk såsom ITIL
* Erfarenhet inom Ivanti Suite, FSLogix, Powershell, VMWare, vSAN, Endpoint management
* Kunskap om Netscaler, Applayering, provisioning, WEM, 2FA
* Linux erfarenhet
* Jobbat med Ansible
* Jobbat med Gitlab


Vi söker dig somär driven, tar egna initiativ och är självgående. Du har ett genuint intresse av att lära dig och förstå ny teknik, samt visar god förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya tekniska område genom att vara framåtriktad och lösningsorienterad. Vi ser gärna också att du är förtroendeskapande, både inom den egna gruppen och mot övrig verksamhet. Du trivs i förändring och har en naturlig strävan mot ständiga förbättringar. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, och ödmjukt förhållningssätt till människor omkring dig. Du trivs att samarbeta med andra och har även god struktur i ditt egna arbete.

 **Ytterligare information** **Vi erbjuder**  

Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. description:

Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi på Vattenfall IT söker nu en Operations Engineer inom Virtual client & system software solutions (Citrix) som vill arbeta med utveckling och leverans av våra IT-tjänster, där säker och stabil drift är högsta prioritet. Vi erbjuder en spännande teknikroll och för dig som kandidat är det här en chans att ta plats i en organisation som genomgår en spännande förvandling med nya tekniska lösningar och utökade samarbetsytor.


Som Operations Engineer kommer du att vara en del av ett team men vi ser även att du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt mot externa leverantörer såväl som kollegor runt om i Sverige och Europa. För dig som individ finns det stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och påverkan i den dagliga leveransen.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Drift och övervakning av centralt managerade kundmiljöer
* Säkerställa att befintliga miljöer utvecklas och ansvara för design och implementation av lösningar
* Delta i transformations- och förändringsprojekt
* Effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Patchhantering och uppgradering
* Felsökning i varierad storlek och komplexitet

  

**Kvalifikationer**  

* Arbetat i stora miljöer både med drift och utveckling av IT-infrastruktur
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet av Citrix CVAD, Windows server, Windows 11
* Har kunskap om VDI, AD, GPO, Nätverk
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat i både tal och skrift
* Förstår och anammar högt IT säkerhetstänk
* Innehar körkort B

**Det är meriterande om du har:**

* Kunskaper om IT-relaterade processer och ramverk såsom ITIL
* Erfarenhet inom Ivanti Suite, FSLogix, Powershell, VMWare, vSAN, Endpoint management
* Kunskap om Netscaler, Applayering, provisioning, WEM, 2FA
* Linux erfarenhet
* Jobbat med Ansible
* Jobbat med Gitlab


Vi söker dig somär driven, tar egna initiativ och är självgående. Du har ett genuint intresse av att lära dig och förstå ny teknik, samt visar god förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya tekniska område genom att vara framåtriktad och lösningsorienterad. Vi ser gärna också att du är förtroendeskapande, både inom den egna gruppen och mot övrig verksamhet. Du trivs i förändring och har en naturlig strävan mot ständiga förbättringar. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, och ödmjukt förhållningssätt till människor omkring dig. Du trivs att samarbeta med andra och har även god struktur i ditt egna arbete.

title: Älskar du att omsätta din teoretiska teknikkunskap till praktik?
description:
*Vill du arbeta hands-on med avancerad teknik och samtidigt resa mycket – både inom Sverige och internationellt? Vi söker dig som tycker att det är stimulerande att byta miljö, arbeta i fält och lösa problem där tekniken ska fungera på riktigt!*  

  

**Om rollen**  

Vi söker tekniskt drivna personer till vårt resande teknikteam. Här arbetar du med integration, installation och test av avancerade lednings- och kommunikationssystem bestående av mjukvara, elektriska och mekaniska komponenter.  

Det praktiska arbetet är en stor del av vardagen – du kommer att löda, koppla, testa, felsöka och säkerställa att systemen fungerar i skarpa miljöer.  

  

**Resa är en central del av jobbet**  

Du kommer att:  

* Resa mycket i tjänsten och vara borta i längre sammanhängande perioder.
* Arbeta på plats hos kund, både nationellt och internationellt.

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

Du kommer bland annat att:  

* Bygga, koppla och integrera system i verklig miljö.
* Utföra test, verifiering och dokumentation.
* Lösa tekniska problem på plats hos kund.

  

**Vi tror att du:**  

* Har ett stort teknikintresse och älskar praktiskt arbete.
* Trivs med att resa mycket och kan vara borta längre perioder.
* Är självgående, lösningsorienterad och gillar utmaningar.
* Har teoretisk förståelse men vill framför allt göra tekniken verklig.
  

Erfarenhet av SIL (Software-in-the-loop) eller HIL (Hardware-in-the-loop) är starkt meriterande.  

  

Teknikområden som förekommer i rollen.  

* Lednings- och kommunikationssystem.
* Mjukvara och systemintegration.
* Elektriska och mekaniska komponenter.
* Test, verifiering och driftsättning.

  

**Krav**  

* Godkänd bakgrundskontroll och säkerhetsprövning.
* Flexibilitet att resa och vara borta i längre perioder.
* Teknisk examen (ingenjör) eller tekniker med motsvarande erfarenhet.

**Om MW Group**  

MW Group är ett modernt nordiskt totalförsvarsbolag som levererar teknik, tjänster och personal för Nordens samhällskritiska infrastruktur, totalförsvar samt privata företag och, myndigheter. MW Group levererar tjänster till samhällsviktiga funktioner på den nordiska hemmamarknaden och utomlands om behovet är globalt. MW Group är partner med den svenska, finska och danska försvarsmakten.
company_description: MW Group provides service solutions tailored to our clients’ needs within the defence, security, and critical societal industry.

title: GPU Hardware Intern
description:
Job ID 2025-15219


Date posted Nov. 07, 2025


Location Lund, Sweden


Category Hardware Engineering


  
Have you ever wondered what powers the technology all around us? How do tiny chips enable us to book tickets, stream movies, play games, browse social media, or stay connected with friends and family? Behind that everyday magic lies an incredibly sophisticated computing system.


If you’re curious about how it all works, join us at Arm! Be part of the journey shaping the future of graphics technology as a member of the Lund GPU Hardware Team. Here at the Lund Design Center, we create world-class mobile Graphics Processors.


About the Internship


Are you a motivated and curious student who’s excited about hardware and software development? Do you enjoy solving problems, learning from others, and contributing in a multicultural, inclusive environment? If so, we’d love to hear from you!


Internship start: June 2026


Duration: Approximately 10 weeks


What you could be doing as an Intern?

* Collaborate with experienced engineers and contribute to real projects
* Explore and analyze solutions to improve performance and functionality
* Read specifications and turn ideas into code
* Enhance our workflows using automation
* Present your findings and share your ideas with the team


We are looking for individuals who:

* Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field
* Experience with programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or JavaScript
* Strong teamwork and communication skills in English


Qualities that will help your application stand out:

* Experience with Linux, shell scripting, or object-oriented programming
* Familiarity with hardware description languages (VHDL or Verilog)
* Understanding of hardware design and verification techniques


Additional Information:


We encourage early applications as we review them on a first come/first served basis. Please apply as soon as you feel ready.Please provide an academic transcript as part of your application.


Arm Internships require you to be enrolled in a higher education degree and be returning to your course after your internship/placement.


In Return:


Working on interesting new projects with leaders in the field is exciting, but we also know how important it is to receive support. That's why throughout your internship, you can expect regular feedback and development opportunities, social activities to connect with your peers, an end of internship celebration, plus the opportunity to be \*considered for future Graduate positions (\*subject to performance). #getreadytogrow


In addition to a competitive salary and rewards package, our on-the-job learning and mentoring/buddy schemes provide unparalleled learning and networking opportunities from the best in the industry.
Our 10x mindset guides how we engineer, collaborate, and grow. Understand what it means and how to reflect 10x in your work: https://careers.arm.com/en/10x-mindset
#LI-SS1


Accommodations at Arm


At Arm, we want to build extraordinary teams. If you need an adjustment or an accommodation during the recruitment process, please email accommodations@arm.com. To note, by sending us the requested information, you consent to its use by Arm to arrange for appropriate accommodations. All accommodation or adjustment requests will be treated with confidentiality, and information concerning these requests will only be disclosed as necessary to provide the accommodation. Although this is not an exhaustive list, examples of support include breaks between interviews, having documents read aloud, or office accessibility. Please email us about anything we can do to accommodate you during the recruitment process.


Hybrid Working at Arm


Arm’s approach to hybrid working is designed to create a working environment that supports both high performance and personal wellbeing. We believe in bringing people together face to face to enable us to work at pace, whilst recognizing the value of flexibility. Within that framework, we empower groups/teams to determine their own hybrid working patterns, depending on the work and the team’s needs. Details of what this means for each role will be shared upon application. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution. Please talk to us to find out more about what this could look like for you.


Equal Opportunities at Arm


Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: GPU Compiler Intern
description:
Job ID 2025-15208


Date posted Nov. 07, 2025


Location Lund, Sweden


Category Software Engineering


  
We are looking for a motivated and curious student, interested in compiler technologies, who wants to contribute to our GPU compiler. Are you creative and like new technologies? Love to collaborate with others? Want to work in a multi-national and multi-cultural environment? If so, we would love to hear from you!


This internship begins in June 2026 for approximately 10 weeks. As an intern, you will contribute to making a real difference, be encouraged to share innovative ideas and learn new skills.


What you could be doing as an Intern?


Your role will be to work on some of the team tasks and get familiar with different aspects of the GPU compiler development. You will be working with dedicated and engaged people as part of our multi-site development projects. We develop primarily in C/C++, and your work will have an impact on the functionality and performance of our GPUs!


We are looking for individuals who:


Are currently enrolled and studying towards a Degree in Computer Science or a related field (Bachelors, Masters or PHD students welcome). Candidates with alternative degrees will also be considered if they have relevant experience.

* Curious about and good understanding of compiler technology, e.g., from university courses
* Experienced in programming, preferably C/C++
* Good English communication skills, both written and verbal


Qualities that will help your application stand out:

* Experience with LLVM

We believe in bringing people together face to face to enable us to work at pace, whilst recognizing the value of flexibility. Within that framework, we empower groups/teams to determine their own hybrid working patterns, depending on the work and the team’s needs. Details of what this means for each role will be shared upon application. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution. Please talk to us to find out more about what this could look like for you.


Equal Opportunities at Arm


Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
